loans.name: Kolotita

texts.en: Kolotita is 63 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Kolotita has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar and oil. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Kolotita hopes to save her profits for the children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina is a 66-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living; she has been doing this for 5 years. Evelina has requested a loan to buy items such as manure, a back sprayer, shovels, barbed wire and tarpaulin.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Evelina hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy items such as manure, a back sprayer, shovels, barbed wire and tarpaulin.

loans.name: Havea

texts.en: Havea is 47 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by owning and operating a small store where she sells items such as soft drinks, corn beef, snacks, meat and canned food. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and plans to use the additional income she earns to pay her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2010 in order to gain access to the capital she needs to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en: Delilah is 25 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last year, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells food items such as donuts and buns to people who live in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy the equipment and ingredients she needs to improve her business. She recently joined SPBD as a way to get access to the capital, and plans to use the additional income she earns to improve her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for a food-making business.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells elei, a traditional Samoan printed fabric, to earn a living and has been doing this for 5 years. Ivoga has requested a loan to buy rolls of plain material, material paint, stencil (designs) and a print roller. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of plain material, material paint, stencil (designs) and a print  roller.

loans.name: Sunepa

texts.en: Sunepa is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a small plantation where she grows taro, yams and bananas. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and two wheelbarrows. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010, and hopes to use the increased income made possible by this loan to help pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and two wheelbarrows

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 26 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling snacks, popcorn, ice pops, etc. in her community and has been doing this for two years. Rosalina has requested a loan to purchase new food items. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rosalina will extend her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase new food items and new containers for storage

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is 70 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for three years. Silia has requested a loan to buy four fishing nets and two diving suits. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Silia will help pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 4 fishing nets and 2 diving suits

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 32-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has five years of experience with this business.

 Fatima has requested a loan to buy a brand new sewing machine, 10 rolls of material, and 10 packets of thread. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a brand new sewing machine, 10 rolls of material, and 10 packets of thread

loans.name: Epi

texts.en:
Epi is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Epi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds and farming tools such as rakes, gardening tools, knives, and fertilisers to help with the growing and improving of her business.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Epi will spend her profits to extend her business and save more for family events.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and other resources to help improve the business

loans.name: Gulsayra

texts.ru: Гулсайре 31 год. В 2006 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулсайра начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Гулсайра сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в сумме от 3,000 до 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ее хозяйство насчитывает  2 коровы и 35 голов мелкого рогатого скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсайра обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Гулсайра  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulsayra is 31 years old. In search of a source of income for her family, Gulsayra started her business of livestock breeding in 2006, having begun with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and hard work, Gulsayra was able to grow her business to a monthly income of 3,000 som to 10,000 som (KGS). Currently her farm counts 2 cows and 35 heads of sheep and goats. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulsayra turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Gulsayra plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es:
La socia Senaida continua dedicandose a la venta de verdura , crianza de animales menores como pollos,cuyes y venta de chicha; la socia lleva años en sus negocios los cuales les va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a sus negocios,la socia tambien continua dedicandose a la ganaderia ,la socia es una persona empeñosa y responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos para sus animalitos como maiz.

La socia se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Senaida, continues to work selling vegetables, raising young animals like chickens and guinea pigs, and selling chicha [a popular drink made from corn]. Senaida has worked in her businesses for years, and they are going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into them every day. Senaida also continues to raise livestock. She is a hardworking and responsible person, and that's how she keeps her family going.

The member is requesting this loan to purchase feed, such as corn, for her young animals. 

Senaida feels grateful for the loan, and she is committed to her repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy feed for her young animals, like corn.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 26-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing products including taro and yams to earn a living. Litia has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. Litia has just started as a member of SPBD. Litia will use her profit to improve her business and cover family related expenses.

loans.use: to buy items for her business including bush knives (machetes), digging tools, rakes and wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en: Faapisa is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living; she has been doing this for 3 years. Faapisa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Faapisa hopes to remodel her old house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene la iniciativa de fortalecer el negocio de la venta  de alborotos, esto le ayudara para que pueda obtener maíz, maicillo y dulce de panela, que son los usados en la preparación  de los alborotos.
Ella considera que este préstamo le ayudara nuevamente a mejorar la condición del negocio, dándole lo necesario para continuar produciendo los alborotos, ya que con su experiencia anterior ha logrado permanecer realizando la venta.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan so that she can strengthen her business of selling "alborotos" (a sweet snack made from sorghum, similar to popcorn balls). The money will help her obtain corn, sorghum, and unrefined sugar since these ingredients are used in preparing the "alborotos".

María considers this loan to be a great help in improving the condition of her business. This will provide what she needs to continue making "alborotos". In her previous experience, she was able to continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy corn, sorghum, and unrefined sugar.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula. 
Ella desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería como: zapatos, lociones, cremas, cosméticos etc. También trae mercadería por encargo lo que el cliente le pida.  Ella vende de manera ambulante en los alrededores de la zona.  Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y espera que con las ganancias que obtenga reinvertir  y seguir trabajando.
El préstamo que solicita es para comprar más mercadería que no tiene como lociones, cremas, cosméticos etc.  Y suplir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes con algunos clientes. 
Su meta es suplir  todas las necesidades de su familia dándole un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 61, is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  They live in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

She has been selling merchandise like shoes, lotions, creams, and cosmetics, etc. for five years.  She also gets merchandise to fill her customers orders.    This business is her source of income, and she hopes that she can use the income to reinvest and continue working.

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise that she does not have.  She will buy merchandise like lotions, creams, and cosmetics, etc.  Then she will fill some pending customer orders.

Her goal is supply her family with all of the necessities and to give them a better lifestyle.

loans.use: buy merchandise like lotions, creams, and cosmetics, etc. and to fill some pending customer orders.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de  un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde el vecindario donde vive hasta el mercado local. Ella nos manifiesta que su experiencia como socia de FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena ya que brindan préstamos con los cuales las mujeres pueden emprender un negocio. Su sueño es comprar su casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su vehículo para que pueda seguir con el transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Llapanchik communal bank.  She is 39 years old, married, and she has a son.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years.

She devotes herself to passenger transportation from the neighborhood where she lives to the local market.  

She tells us that her experience as a member of FINCA Péru has been very good.  This is because they grant loans with which the women are able to undertake a business.  Her dream is to buy her own house.

She will use the requested loan for maintenance on her vehicle in order to be able to continue transporting passengers.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on her vehicle in order to be able to continue transporting passengers.

loans.name: Aloiafi

texts.en: Aloiafi is a 28-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a flea-market in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. Aloiafi has requested a loan to buy more materials for sewing clothes to be sold. She plans to use her profits to improve the business and her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for sewing clothes to sell

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 35 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling snack food in her community and has been doing this for one year. Ioana has requested a loan to buy more goods to be sold in her canteen like noodles, twisties, Chinese lollies, soft drinks, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ioana will improve her canteen and pay for her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy more goods to be sold in her canteen

loans.name: Isaac Guillermo

texts.en:
Isaac is 48 years old and lives with his partner in their house in the rural area of Tambograndre in Northern Peru. For years he has been dedicated to agriculture and the raising of animals to earn an income to meet his family's needs. His main agricultural assets are his lemon crop and a few animals that represent the only source of income for his family.

Isaac is requesting a loan for 1800 soles to invest in his business, consolidate potential sources of growth and improve his family's living conditions. With this loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers to improve the yield and health of his lemon crop, in addition to buying animal feed to improve the quality of his animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Tupe

texts.en:
Tupe is a 22-year-old married woman with one child. 

She would like to start growing cabbages, carrots, and tomatoes to earn a living. Tupe has requested a loan to purchase cabbage, cucumber, and tomato seeds, and a rake, shovel, and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Tupe will spend her profits to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, cucumber, and tomato seeds, and a rake, shovel, and gloves.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio actualmente vive con sus padres, trabaja en una maquiladora, como todo joven tiene el sueño de casarse, pero por el momento empezó la construcción de un cuarto para vivir provisionalmente con sus padres y para ello necesita comprar material ya que le falta una pared y enjarrar. Es responsable y trabajador  contribuye en los gastos de su casa, pues quiere ayudar a su familia a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio currently lives with his parents.  He works in a factory.  Like all young men, he dreams of getting married.  

However, at the present time he has started to build a room in order to live with his parents for the time being.  In order to do this he needs to buy material to build a wall and plaster it.

He is responsible, and he is a hard-worker who contributes to the household expenses.  He wants to help his family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Takeshi Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “TAKESHI” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Susana es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de mangueras, venta de CD’s, venta de material de limpieza, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa femenina.
La señora Susana cuenta que hace diez años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus compañeras; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza, mismo que trabaja hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana mayor.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cerveza) los que comprarán de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo venderá en las fiestas comunales. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “TAKESHI” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and Susana is their president.  The ladies' business activities are varied and include: buying and selling hosepipes, selling CDs, selling cleaning supplies, selling beer, running a neighborhood store and selling ladies' clothing.  

Susana tells us that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for ten years.  She was invited to join by a fellow member.  Susana's business is selling beer and she has been in it for a number of years, having learned from her older sister.

The loan that Susana is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying beer).  She will buy her goods from distributors and then sell them during local fiestas.  This work enables her to support her family.  Susana is married and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana replied that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is a 70-year-old widow with 10 children. She makes and sells handicrafts to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Fuatino has requested a loan to buy more materials to improve the business such as fabric paint, needles, thread, weaving knives, and "bandanus" leaves. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for business improvement

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is a 39-year-old married woman with one child. She sells fish in her community to earn a living and has 3 years of experience with this business. Koreti needs a loan to buy fishing net and a new canoe. She plans to use her profits to pay for her child's education. Koreti has been a member of SPBD since last year.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a new canoe.

loans.name: Tavae

texts.en: Tavae is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Tavae has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, manure and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Tavae will spend her profits to continue her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, manure and a spade.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows tomatoes and cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Emi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, hose, and wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Emi hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, hose, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tamila has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, hose, and barbed wire.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Tamila hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, a rake, hose, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community, which she has been doing  for two years.
 
Ulata is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fishing equipment such as fishing net and spears..She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ulata will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y es dueña de una tienda donde vende carne y  golosinas. Ella manifiesta que todo lo que ha conseguida es por su propio trabajo y esfuerzo. Su sueño es progresar al lado de su hijo y brindarle una buena educación y cuidados. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para que luego pueda venderla en su tienda.
texts.en: Emilia is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, she is 52 years old, and a single mother of a boy child. She's been a member of FINCA Peru for two years and she is the owner of a shop where she sells meat and candy. She expresses that everything that she has achieved is through her own work and effort. Her dream is to make progress alongside her son and give him a good education and take good care of him. The loan that she is asking for will be invested in buying clothing so that later she can sell it in her store.

loans.use: to buy clothing so that she can later sell it in her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 meses y se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella dice que ser socia de FINCA Perú ha sido una buena experiencia ya que le brindaron un préstamo cuando mas lo necesitaba que le permitió emprender un negocio y también le enseñaron a ahorrar que es lo que más le gusta. Su sueño es progresar al lado de su familia y realizar mejoras a su casa, y sobre todo brindarles una educación profesional a sus hijas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, vegetales, carne que necesita para preparar la comida que vende.
texts.en: Gloria is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two daughters.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for six months and her business is selling food.  She says that being a member of FINCA Peru has been a good experience because they gave her a loan when she most needed it, enabling her to start a business.  They have also taught her to save which is what she likes the most.  Gloria's dreams are to make progress alongside her family and to make some improvements to her home.  Above all, she would like to provide her daughters with a college education.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying ingredients such as rice, sugar, oil, vegetables and meat that she needs for preparing the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, oil, vegetables and meat which she needs for preparing the food that she sells

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.en:
Melquiades is a 32-year-old married man with 4 children living in the rural area of Tambogrande in Northern Peru. His main activity is raising pigs, cows and poultry.  He also has a hectare of land dedicated to his lemon crop. Over the last 8 years, Melquiades has developed an expertise in these areas of agriculture and has started applying rudimentary technology to help him improve the quality of his products.

Part of his advancement and success has been made possible thanks to previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa.  He is now requesting a loan to invest specifically in his lemon crop.  Melquiades would like to increase the yield, quality and profitability of his lemon crop in order to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy products to improve the yield and quality of his lemon crop thereby making him a more competitive farmer.

loans.name: Luafuluvalu

texts.en:
Luafuluvalu is a 35-year-old married woman with four children.
 
She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Luafuluvalu has requested a loan to buy manure, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, and water. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Luafuluvalu will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy manure, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, and water.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en:
Marleny is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her son in their own house in the north of Peru. They have basic water and electricity services. She has developed a small general store in her home, which she runs in the morning. Her mother runs it in the afternoon. In addition, she dedicates part of her time to raising and selling pigs.

Furthermore, she has found a part-time job working as a secretary, which allows her to have a constant, if small, income for her family. Her husband's main activity is fishing, and together they constitute a very hard-working family. She is now planning on taking a loan of 1,000 soles, which would be invested in the purchase of goods for her store in order to offer more products and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop in order to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Florencia Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia tiene 41 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 15, 12 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de sombreros y mantas para mujeres de polleras, tu tienda se encuentran en la zona de Ovejuyo,  este préstamo es su octava secuencia, ella es cliente antigua de la institución, la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de sombreros y mantas para  su negocio ya que por esta fechas que se acerca el aniversario del barrio tiene mucha venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are 15, 12 and 6 years old.  Her business is selling hats and shawls for ladies who dress in traditional clothing.  Her store is located in Ovejuyo district.  This loan is Sonia's eighth.  She is a long-standing client of the institution.

Sonia will use her loan to buy hats and shawls for her business because right now the neighborhood anniversary is approaching and she makes lots of sales at this time of year.  Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can increase her working capital.  Sonia faces challenges in her business.  One challenge is stocking up with merchandise.  Sonia will use her profits to continue buying her products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy hats and shawls wholesale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos (dos mujeres y un hijo varón). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 12 años y es feriante, vende productos en las ferias que se elaboran en la cuidad. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú y gracia a las capacitaciones que recibe en du Bancomunal ella ha aprendido a ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño es poder brindarles una educación profesional a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales como quinua, trigo, quiwicha para que los pueda vender en la feria de la cuidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three children (two daughters and one son).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years and sells products in the street markets that take place in her city.  She says that during her time as a FINCA Peru member and thanks to the training sessions that she has attended as a member of her community bank, she has learned to be responsible and punctual.

Sonia's dream is to be able provide her children with a college education.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cereals such as quinoa, wheat and kiwicha (amaranth) to sell in the city market.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as quinoa, wheat and kiwicha (amaranth) to sell

loans.name: Sovita

texts.en:
Sovita is 44 years old and married. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy spear, goggles, fishing net, and a new canoe. 
 
Sovita joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. In the future, she hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy spear, goggles, fishing net, and a new canoe.

loans.name: Berna

texts.es: Berna es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos (2 varones y 4 mujeres). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace muchos años y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo ha aprendido la puntualidad y la responsabilidad. Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa propia que comparta con su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales como trigo, quinua, quiwicha para que los pueda vender en su negocio.
texts.en: Berna is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 60 years old, married, and has six children (two sons and four daughters).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for many years and her business is buying and selling cereals.  She says that, over the years, she has learned to be punctual and responsible.  Berna's dream is to be able to buy her own home to share with her family.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cereals such as wheat, quinoa and kiwicha (amaranth) so that she can sell them in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as wheat, quinoa and kiwicha (amaranth) to sell

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La socia Aydee continua trabajando en uno de los restaurantes de Urubamba,ella es cheff de profesion, ya son varios años que trabaja en este restaurante el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo,la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aydee continues working in a restaurant in Urubamba.  She is a chef by profession.  She has worked in this particular restaurant for a number of years and is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At the same time, Aydee also raises animals such as guinea pigs which she sells to customers who request them.  Aydee is a responsible and hard-working person who has a great desire to continue making progress for her family's sake.

Aydee is requesting this loan to buy chickens for her business.  She feels grateful for the loan she has been given and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es socia del Bancomunal Llapanchik y tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y  madre tres hijos (un varón y 2 mujeres). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la venta de cereales. Ella dice que lo que más le gusta son las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que le enseñan como ahorrar, a cuidar a su familia y cuidarse así misma.  Su sueño es poder comprar una casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales como trigo, quinua, quiwicha para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Gabriela is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children (one son and two daughters).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years and her business is selling cereal.  She says that what she likes most are the training sessions that she receives as a member of her community bank because they teach her how to save and how to care for both her family and herself.  Her dream is to buy her own home.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cereals such as wheat, quinoa and kiwicha (amaranth) to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as wheat, quinoa and kiwicha (amaranth) to sell

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
Andy works for Watu na Nuru, a Barefoot Power distributor in Tanzania. This is his story:

I have been working in Tanzania with my wife for four years now, and I have been using my previous project management experience to help in the development of new projects in this rural part of Tanzania. We have a son living in Sweden and a daughter back in Australia. The very limited access to electricity supply, especially in remote areas such as Kagera, means that solar lighting presents opportunities for people to study and work in the evenings, helping to reduce poverty. They also avoid the need to use dangerous kerosene lamps, reducing costs, improving health and reducing the risk of fires. A large part of my work for the Anglican Church over the last year was starting a retail business to sell solar lights locally and distribute them to micro-entrepreneurs and small businesses who want to sell them in villages. We have also trained new staff and provided employment locally and aim to develop a self-sustaining enterprise. 

Watu na Nuru needs to have sufficient quantities of the right products at the best time of year (when farmers bring in their harvest). We need funds to ensure product is available when people are ready to buy it. We have developed a partnership with Barefoot Power Australia, who make what we believe are the best micro-solar systems on the market. When we are not selling product, we provide training and technical support to retailers and micro-entrepreneurs because we want to ensure these lights continue working for years. My greatest challenge in this role is maintaining supply lines to the remote areas in a region the size of Rwanda. Your loan will support our stock so that more village entrepreneurs can sell these lighting solutions. My favourite part of this job is hearing our customers tell us what a huge difference solar has made in their lives!

loans.use: To buy stock of micro-solar lighting kits from a Barefoot Power wholesaler

loans.name: Faiane

texts.en: Faiane is a 59-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, taamu, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faiane has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, and some taro roots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Faiane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, etc

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is a 21-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro to earn a living. Faleupolu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, and barbed wire. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Faleupolu will use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, and barbed wire

loans.name: Vaitupua

texts.en: Vaitupua is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Vaitupua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, and taro roots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Vaitupua hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, and taro roots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, cuenta con casa propia en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  ella se dedica al comercio de periódicos teniendo así un puesto de venta en una de  las avenidas más concurridas, la señora es conocida por la institución como una persona  responsable ya que es cliente antigua, también es conocida en su barrio y lugar de trabajo por ser una persona amable y jovial con sus clientes, la Sra. Teresa con el dinero del crédito comprara revistas por mayor para vender en su puesto, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien por este motivo quiere seguir comprando revistas,  se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito, el deseo de la Sra. teresa es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Teresa has four school-age children and owns her own home in the San Pedro area of the city of Cochabamba.  Her business is selling newspapers and she has a sales location on one of the busiest avenues.  She is known to the institution as a responsible person because she is a long-standing client.  She is also known in her neighborhood and place of work for being kind and cheerful to her customers.  Teresa will use her loan money to buy magazines wholesale.  She will then sell these from her sales location.  Her previous loan was very useful and so she would like to continue buying magazines.  She feels grateful to the institution for the support they are giving her through this loan.  Teresa's wish is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a range of magazines

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Rita.  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 7 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her sister. 

 In 2005, Rita established her cooking business. She began her business because she needed to earn her living. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Rita requires a loan in order to buy five cantors chicken @100,000 and 10 gallons of cooking oil @ le 250,000 . She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000. 

Rita is excited about the loan and she is planning to expand her business.Rita is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy five cantors chicken @100,000 and 10 gallons of cooking oil @ le 250,000 .

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has three children aged 12, 15, and 10 years. She has no additional dependents living with her.  In 2000, Hawa established her business selling local foodstuffs like groundnuts, rice, and "benni" (sesame seeds). She began her business because she needed to  earn her living. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy 11 bags of beans @ Le,450,000 and will use Le 50,000 for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000. Hawa is excited about the loan and she is planning to expand her business. Honest and hard-working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 11 bags of beans @ Le, 450,000 and the Le 50,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Tereso De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Tereso tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Él es agricultor desde la edad de seis años, fue su papá quien le enseño. Cultiva maíz, maicillo y chilipucos (son similares a los frijoles, pero más grandes). Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, Tereso camina unos diez minutos a pie por una calle polvosa, luego aborda un autobús durante diez minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos. 

El señor solicita el préstamo para comprar cuatro sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas y para pago de mano de obra; para sembrar 10.500 metros cuadrados de maíz, maicillo y chilipucos. Él, primero siembra el maíz a los 22 días siembra en el mismo lugar el maicillo y en agosto siembra los chilipucos. Con el crédito comprara todo lo que necesita para sus cultivos, aplicándolos a tiempo y de manera adecuada para mejorar su producción y que su cosecha sea mejor que el año anterior. Don Tereso desea cultivar más de lo que hoy en día realiza, él manifiesta que con el crédito se le facilita la compra de insumos y pago de jornalero.
texts.en:
Tereso is 61 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been a farmer since he was six years old, having been taught by his dad.  He grows corn, sorghum and chilipucos (which are similar to kidney beans only larger).  In order to buy his farm supplies, Tereso walks ten minutes along a dusty road then catches a bus for a ten minute ride to the place where he buys his supplies.

The gentleman is requesting this loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay laborers so that he can sow 10,500 square meters of corn, sorghum and chilipuco beans.  First he sows his corn.  After 22 days he sows the sorghum in the same place and then, in August, he sows the chilipuco beans.  He will use his loan to buy everything he needs for his crops.  He will apply the supplies to his crops at the right time and in a suitable manner so that he can improve his production and enjoy a better harvest than last year.  Tereso would like to grow more than he does right now.  He says that this loan will help him to buy the supplies he needs and pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay laborers so that he can sow 10,500 square meters of corn, sorghum and chilipuco beans

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.en:
Maria Andrea is 27 years old and has no children. She lives in her own house in the rural area of Northern Peru. Her main activity is the raising of cows (10), goats (12) and poultry. 



She has been specializing in this type of work for the last four years and has developed a reputation as someone who has a strong knowledge regarding the quality of the animals she commercializes. Based on this, the client is taking a loan of 800 soles to invest in her business, mainly for the purchase of balanced animal feed and some more animals. During this season there should be enough rain to graze animals, but a drier than expected season could jeopordize her plans of increasing the number of animals she raises.

loans.use: to buy more animals and animal feed

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah h muhammed is a 29-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 8. All of them go to school. 

Abdallah runs a shop, and he has been in business for 10 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 3,500 SDG to purchase sugar, oil, soap, milk and many other items. He has no other source of income

Infive5 years, Abdallah would like to open many branches and employ others. 

His major challenges include demonization of markets. 

Abdallah says he want to increase his capital through the loans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, soap, milk, and many other items.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has two children aged 17 and 6 years. She has no additional dependents, who live with her. In 2000, Fatmata established her textiles and bags business. She began her business because she needed to  earn her living. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy 30 suit of Africana dresses @le 150,000 and use Le 500,000 for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000. 

Fatmata is excited about the loan and she is planning to expand her business and open an outlet for her younger brother.Honest and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 30 suit of Africana dresses @le 150,000 and use Le 500,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana sigue laborando en servicios domésticos, sus hijos cursan el año escolar y su esposo trabajando de albañil, ambos se esfuerzan para lograr una mejor vivienda, es por tal razón los dos trabajan.
Difícil ah veces dejar a los pequeños solo, pero pensando en un futuro mejor y digno para su familia, en donde lo están logrando, junto con Afodenic, quien ha otorgado financiamiento, con el fin de mejor un mejor techo.
Con este nuevo préstamo, embaldosará la sala y cuarto a si como repellar las paredes internas y levantar más alto la división. Comprando arena, cemento, bloque y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ana continues working as a maid.  Her children are in school and her husband works as a builder.  The couple work hard so that they can achieve a better home for their family.  This is the reason they both work.  It is sometimes difficult to leave the little ones alone but they are planning for a better, decent future for their family.  They are achieving this together with Afodenic who have offered them loans so that they can have a better home.

Ana will use this new loan to tile her living room and bedroom.  She will also plaster her internal walls and raise the dividing walls higher.  She will buy sand, cement and blocks, and start the job.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can plaster and tile some rooms

loans.name: Olioli

texts.en:
Olioli is 39 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and cucumber, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Olioli needs a loan to buy chemicals and vegetable seeds, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Olioli will use the profits from her sales to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a married mother of seven dependents, is 44 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. A farmer who has been growing rice to earn a living for 16 years, she earns PHP 10,000 per month.

Vilma has been a member of GDMPC since 2008 and is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. In the future, she hopes to gain more profit and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en: Uldarico is from Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 48 years old. Uldarico is married and has four children. Uldarico used his last loan to purchase food ingredients to expand his product offerings. His business is successful, and he is taking out a new loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business even more.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur has been raising pigs for more than 4 years and earns 22,815 per month. She’s 49 years old now yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to give adequate livelihood for her two children. She became a member of GDMPC in 2008. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing the amount of 24,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Luz hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, a 60-year-old married mother of six, lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental where she has a “tilapia’” fish culture and vending business, earning approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month. A member of PMPC for five years, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase feeds for her tilapia culture activity.

In the future, Patricia hopes to introduce her tilapia fish to other areas.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her tilapia culture.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob  is a 52-year-old businessman  who lives in Juba. He is married, and has 4 children between the ages of 15and 25. Four go to school. 

Jacob  runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. An employee of his heard about Finance Sudan through other clients  and he  is taking a loan of 3000
 SDG to purchase more goods. In addition to this business, no. 

In 5 years,open many branches. he hopes to employ more people.

His  major challenges include inflation in the market. 

More loans should to be given.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soda, milk, drinking water, and others.

loans.name: Lojuan

texts.en:
Lojuan patrick  is a 35-year-old businessman  who lives in Juba. he is married, and has 3 children between the ages of 5and 15. 3 go to school. 

lojuan  runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. 1  employee ,heard about Finance Sudan through,other clients  and he  is taking a loan of 3000
 SDG to purchase more goods. In addition to this business, no. 

In 5 years,open many branches. he hopes to employ more people.

His  major challenges include market demolition. 

No comment.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes and women wear

loans.name: Maoina

texts.en:
Maoina is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small business, selling fish to her community, which she has been doing for two years. 

Maoina is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase materials for upgrading her boat. She  joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services. She will use her profits to support her business and her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy materials for her boat

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Noel is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Noel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Noel hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like banana cake and cassava cake.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “AMANECER” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por siete integrantes donde la señora Isabel es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, lavado de autos, venta de zapatos, venta de fierros, venta de cosméticos.
La señora Isabel cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus amigas; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chatarras, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chatarras) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta la capacitación y el ahorro.
En la fotografía no parese la señora Nelly, ya que ella tenía que ir a su comercio de inmediato.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amanecer" (Dawn) is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by Sra. Isabel as its president. The members have developed business activities that include managing a neighborhood store, selling clothes, washing cars, selling shoes, selling iron, and selling cosmetics.

Sra. Isabel says that this is the first time she has joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from one of her friends. She currently has a business that sells scrap metal. Isabel learned this trade from a friend and has been working for many years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying scrap metal, which she will acquire at the fairs in the city of La Paz and then sell from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to help her family move forward. Isabel is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Isabel said that she enjoys the training classes and the savings. In the photograph, Sra. Nelly was not present because she had to attend to immediate business.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,al socia vende chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz y tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,chanchos y pollos y tambien tiene un terreno de cultivo donde cultiva maiz,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y agricultura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes y tambien para comprar animales como cuyes y pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in her agricultural business and selling 'chicha' which is a corn-based drink.  In addition, she also continues working in her business raising animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens, and has a plot of farmland where she grows corn.  Through these businesses, she provides for her children.  This member's dream is to expand her agricultural and animal-raising businesses.

The member is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She will also buy animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

The member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to buy animals such as guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn  is 28  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Arlyn  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for four  years. She requested a loan for  4,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Arlyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Fe y Esperanza” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de comida sushi, venta de ropa interior, venta de pan amasado, venta de pan integral, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Peñalolén, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
María, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un poleron de color café, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía en mosaicos y a la venta de frutos secos, desde hace 3 años, comenta que trabaja los fines de semana en ferias artesanales, y otras veces en las afueras de los mall, y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en  diferentes distribuidoras y supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará cerámica para mosaico, pegamento, resina, almendras, maní, nueces, pasas, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Maria en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de abrir un local, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes 
Maria vive junto a su marido, suegra y su hija de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son establecer un local como una distribuidora para tener una renta más segura, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida familiar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Fe y Esperanza” (Hope and Faith).  It is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who all work in different business activities including, selling sushi, selling underwear, selling homemade bread, selling wholewheat bread and providing services.  All of the group's members live in Peñalolén, in the city of Santiago.

María is the president of this community bank.  In the photo, she is standing on the far right of the second row.  She is wearing a coffee-colored top and  has short, dark brown hair.

María has been making mosaics and selling dried fruit for three years.  She says that that she works weekends in craft fairs and at other times outside malls.  Her work hours vary according to her availability.

María buys her merchandise in different stores and supermarkets at low cost.  This is financially convenient.  She will use her loan to buy mosaic tiles, adhesive, resin, almonds, peanuts, walnuts and raisins with which to stock her business.  One of María's business goals is to open premises from which she can serve her customers.

María lives together with her husband, her mother-in-law and her 12-year-old daughter who is in school.  Her dream is to set up her own store so that she can earn more secure income.  This will allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

María is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza have given her as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the company of the other members of her community bank as they share different activities.  The training sessions that are provided during meetings have taught her how to better run her business.

Peñalolén is located in the east of the Metropolitan region.  It has a number of attractions such as its vineyards, historical buildings and natural sites where you can go on trips.  These elements are turning this area into a new tourist destination within the Metropolitan region.

loans.use: to buy mosaic tiles, adhesive, resin, almonds, peanuts, walnuts and raisins to stock her business

loans.name: Julia Alejandra

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos (un hijo varón y una nena). Es socia de FINCA Perú 3 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa de los niños. Ella nos cuenta que en todo este tiempo que lleva como socia y participando en su Bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar y a ser puntual. Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de artesanías que llevará a Lima para vender en las ferias.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the Bancomunal Capuli (a community bank) and is 42 years old and a single mother of two children (one boy and one little girl).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past 3 years and is in the business of selling children's clothing.  She tells us that in all the time she has been a member and participant in her community bank she has learned to save money and to be punctual.  Her dream for the future is to have a store of her own.  The loan that she is asking for will be invested in buying crafts that she will take to Lima to sell at the markets.

loans.use: to buy crafts which she will take to Lima to sell at the markets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is 62 years old, widowed, and lives with her only single daughter in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She works as a local farmer, cultivating rice and potato crops annually to make a living. Aside from farming, she also makes Khmer cakes to sell in the commune for additional income. Her daughter, 28, does not only help her in the two businesses but she also devotes her time to be a local laborer hired to work on other villagers' plantations. 

Im is now taking out an additional capital of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase fertilizers for her rice crops. With the remaining funds, she will pay for labor costs, for workers she will hire to work on her potato plantation. As for her prospects, she wants to expand her business, renovate her house, and save for the future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  more bamboo used in making mats and walls

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 37 años de edad, y es madre de cuatro hijos (tres hijos varones y una mujercita).  Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 12 años y se dedica a la venta de queso. Ella manifiesta que en todo este tiempo como ha aprendido a ahorrar, a ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño poder brindarles una educación superior a sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales un día. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne para que crezca su negocio donde ya vende quesos.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the Capuli community bank.  She is 37 years old and the mother four children (three sons and one young daughter).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years and her business is selling cheese.  Victoria says that, over the years, she has learned how to save and how to be responsible and punctual.  Her dream is to provide her children with a college education so that they can become professionals one day.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying meat so that she can grow her business which currently sells cheese.

loans.use: to buy meat so that she can grow her business which currently sells cheese

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 34 años, es una mujer sencilla que vive en compañía de Pedro, su esposo, y  tienen tres hijos.
Hace 8 años abrió una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, desde entonces recibe a los pobladores de su localidad, a quienes atiende con mucho amor y paciencia. Asimismo, aprovecha el amplio espacio que tiene en sus terrenos con pastos naturales para criar animales como: cuyes, cerdos y ovejas, los que engorda para luego venderlos a los carniceros. Su esposo trabaja en una mina, donde se interna y después de un tiempo regresa a su casa. Marleny desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos, su primer objetivo es arreglar su vivienda y por ende la infraestructura de su tienda. 

Este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, por lo que agradece al poyo financiero que ha recibido durante todos estos años. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, y además le gusta pertenecer a su grupo, pues las personas son responsables y solidarias. 
Marleny invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cemento para terminar de construir la mitad de su casa.
texts.en:
Marleny is 34 years old, and is a simple woman who lives in the company of Pedro, her husband, and her three children.

About eight years ago, she opened a small grocery store in her home, and since then she's been available to the townspeople of her local area, who she waits on with much love and patience.  At the same time, she takes advantage of the ample space that she has on her property with natural grazing land to raise animals like guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep, who she fattens and then sells to the butchers.  Her husband works in a mine, where he goes underground and comes home after his shift.  Marleny would like to improve their income, her primary objective is to repair their home and thereby the structure of her grocery store.

this will be her 18th loan with MFP, which she thanks for the financial support that she has been given over the years.  She promises to be punctual in her payments, and also she likes being a part of her group because the people in it are responsible and supportive.

Marleny will invest the asked for money in buying cement to finish constructing one half of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de tiene cuatro hijos (dos hijos varones y dos mujeres).  Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años y es comerciante de abarrotes, azúcar, y arroz. Ella dice que durante todo este tiempo ella ha aprendido mucho a ser. Su sueño para el futuro es ser dueña una tienda propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su negocio como azúcar, arroz, harina, fideos, aceite, menestras, etc. para que así pueda aumentar la venta en su negocio.
texts.en: Claudia is a member of the Capuli community bank.  She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.  Her business is selling groceries, sugar and rice.  She says that, over the years, she has learned a lot.  Her dream for the future is to become the owner of her own store.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries for her business such as sugar, rice, flour, noodles, oil, mixed veg. etc. so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business such as sugar, rice, flour, noodles, oil, mixed veg, etc.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.es: Joanne es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de dos hijos varones. . Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Ella manifiesta que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ahorrar y ser puntual. Su sueño para el futuro es abrir un restaurante. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos para que pueda venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Joanne is a member of the Capuli community bank.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two sons.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and her business is selling cosmetics through catalogs.  She says that during her time as a FINCA Peru member she has learned to save and be punctual.  Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell in her business

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Colette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Colette est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Colette est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Colette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Colette vend depuis vingt ans, des poissons frits dans un marché du Bénin. Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Colette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DJROMAHUTON is a group of three people who live in the same district. This is the group’s third time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The group’s representative is Colette, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Colette is 28 years old and she lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Antoine. They have four dependent children who all go to school. Colette lives with her husband and their children. 

To help support the family, Colette has been selling fried fish at a market in Benin for the past twenty years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Colette is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group DJROMAHUTON. This credit will allow them to bolster their activities and boost their profits. Both previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy tiene 34 años, su pareja es Gervasio, producto de su unión tiene tres hijos, a los que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo.
Hace 4 años que cuida la escuela de su localidad, ahí vive junto a su familia, por ese trabajo recibe un sueldo mensual con el que mantiene la economía de su hogar, además de las ganancias que tiene su esposo con su oficio de albañil, quien ahora está en la construcción de un parque. Asimismo, Edy se dedica al cuidado de niños huérfanos en una guardería del estado, su función es cocinar los alimentos de los niños, y ella se siente muy dichosa de poder ayudar de esa manera. Su principal objetivo es construir su casa propia en el terreno que heredó su esposo.

Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP y espera concretar sus planes con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Edy invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción para levantar los cimientos de su casa.
texts.en:
Edy is 34 years old, her partner is Gervasio, and she has three children from her marriage, who she cares for with a lot of love and tenderness in a rented house located in Hualahoyo.

For the past 4 years she has been the groundskeeper of the school in her locality, and she lives there with her family.  For this work, she receives a monthly salary with which she provides for the expenses of her household, along with the earnings of her husband in his work as a bricklayer, who is currently employed in the construction of a park.  Also, Edy works as a caretaker for orphaned children in a state-run childcare center; her job is to cook meals for the children, and she feels very fortunate to be able to help in this way.  Her primary objective is to construct her own house on a piece of land that her husband inherited.

This is the fifth loan she has made with MFP, and she hopes to make her plans real with this financial help.  On the other hand, she promises to complete her payments on time, as she has with her previous loans.  She is thankful to be part of the group because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people.  Edy will invest the asked for money in buying construction materials to lay the foundations of her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for the foundations of her house.

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es:
Mencia tiene 39 años, está casada con Glober, producto de su amor tienen cuatro hijos, a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.
Durante las mañanas trabaja en la limpieza de una casa donde fue contratada hace muchos años; y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y otros aperitivos en una zona muy concurrida y transitada de la ciudad. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en una mina, donde obtiene el dinero suficiente para poder solventar los gastos principales del hogar, lo mano es que solo llega una vez por semana a casa. Mencia desea mejorar la cantidad de sus platos para que sus clientes aumenten.

Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP y le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, pues todas las personas son responsables y solidarias. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además de agradecer el apoyo que le permite continuar con su negocio. 
Este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para sus hamburguesas (panes, carne molida, papas y verduras).
texts.en:
Mencia is 39 years old and married to Glober.  They have four children as the product of their love.  They care for their children in a rental house which is located in the town of Chilca.  

In the mornings, Mencia works cleaning a house where she was hired many years ago.  In the afternoons, she sells burgers and other snacks in a very busy, high traffic area of the city.  Her husband works in a mine where he makes enough money to cover their main household expenses.  The downside is that he only arrives home once a week.  Mencia would like to improve the quantity of dishes that she prepares so that her number of customers increases.

This is Mencia's fourth loan from MFP.  She enjoys belonging to her group as all the members are responsible and supportive people.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  She is grateful for this support which allows her to continue in her business.

Mencia will invest her money in buying supplies and ingredients for her burgers (bread, ground meat, potatoes and vegetables).

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for making her burgers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 42 year old married man. He has a son who is 18 years old. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a food stall and a real estate business. He sells items such as maize, beans, cabbages, onions and provides housing accommodation . He has been involved in this business for 9 years and employs 4 staff members. His business is located within a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road connections to business premises. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses worth Kes 30,000 and cereals worth Kes 40,000. His business goal is to expand his business so as to increase the working capital to Kes 400,000 within 5 years. Peter, this is his fifth loan. He had earlier taken loan proceeds of Kes (20,000, 30,000, 40,000, 50,000) from SMEP DTM which he repaid well. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of cereals.

loans.use: to pay for his rental houses renovation worth Kes 30,000 and buy cereals worth Kes 40,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman who has three children. Marichu is thirty-eight years old, and resides in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marichu owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to pay for the labor cost of planting rice. In 2011, Marichu joined GDMPC. In the future, Marichu wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of planting rice.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is a thirty-nine-year-old man and is married to Tolfiana, a thirty-five-year-old-woman. They have been blessed with four children: Intan, sixteen, who is in first grade of senior high school; Rini, nine, who is attending fourth grade of elementary school; Imelda, eight, who is attending first grade of elementary school; and Grasilia, two.

Simeon is a shop-keeper with a limited income. He absolutely knows that it’s going to be hard if he only relies on the income from being a shop-keeper. Therefore, besides working as a shop-keeper, Simeon built a small kiosk in front of his house in 2009. 

Simeon would like to improve the business by enlarging the kiosk building. To enable him to implement his plan, Simeon then applied for individual loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on building materials and more stock for his kiosk including: sugar, snacks, coffee, tea, cigarettes, shampoo, umbrellas, etc. He hopes that the business will grow well.

loans.use: to buy building materials and more stock for his kiosk including sugar, snacks, coffee, tea, cigarettes, shampoo and umbrellas.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a recurrent borrower with Ugafode Mfi Ltd (MDI) from Ibanda District. The client is married with three children, and is engaged in the transport business locally known as boda boda. 

The client's first loan was UGX 1,000,000 (one million shillings) from Ugafode, which he used to buy a motorcycle. He completed payment and borrowed 1,300,000 UGX, which he used to buy a newer motorcycle since the previous one had become old. The client repaid and completed the loan, and is now borrowing UGX 1,400,000, which he will use to buy a second motorcycle. This will help him to boost his income so that he will ably meet his family's needs.

The client's wife is engaged in agriculture, which supplements their family income.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 37 años, que vive con Jenny en unión de hecho con quien tiene dos pequeños hijos de los cuales uno está actualmente cursando la educación primaria. Viven en "Quinindé" un cantón perteneciente a la provincia costanera de "Esmeraldas" la cual se caracteriza por su riqueza en flora y fauna por contar con un clima tropical húmedo y tener un espeso bosque. Las poblaciones de la provincia en general han tenido un progreso notable, gracias a la creación de vías de acceso diferentes a al fluvial que, hasta hace unos años, era la única que daba acceso a estas poblaciones. La población de este cantón se dedica en su mayoría a actividades agrícolas principalmente a la siembra de palma, banano y maracuyá.

Desde hace 10 años Pedro se dedica a sembrar palma y otros productos tradicionales de la región. Esta actividad le ha permitido no solamente sacar adelante a su familia sino dar trabajo ocasional a personas de escasos recursos. Pedro desea fortalecer su plantación comprando semilla y fertilizantes para lo cual requiere un crédito. El desea mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. 


Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando la tierra y en un futuro dar trabajo estable a los pobladores que como el desean mejorar sus condiciones socioeconómicas.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 37-year-old gentleman who is in a common-law relationship with Jenny. They have two young children, one of whom is currently attending elementary school. Pedro and his family reside in Quinindé, a canton in the coastal province of Esmeraldas.
