This area is known for its abundance of plant and animal life due to the tropical weather conditions and the presence of a dense rain forest. The residents of this province have made considerable progress, thanks in part to the creation of various access roads that lead to the river. Just a few years ago, there was only one access road that could reach these towns. The residents of this canton engage primarily in farming activities, specifically the cultivation of oil palms, bananas, and passion fruit.

For the past 10 years, Pedro has been growing oil palms and other traditional products of the region. Not only has he been able to help his family get ahead, but he has also provided occasional work to people with limited resources. Pedro wants to strengthen his plantation by purchasing seeds and fertilizers, which is why he is requesting this loan. He hopes to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

His dream is to continue working the land. In the future, he hopes to provide stable jobs to those residents who want to improve their socioeconomic conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Japhet, who is in his late 20s, is married with one child who is still small. He has been running a Video Library and performing music on big occasions, for one and a half year now. He works from 8:00 am to midnight  and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to buy more CD, DVD, VCD and music system repair. His dream is to one day be able to start a decoration project. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Pamoja" which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more CD, DVD, VCD and music system repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is forty-four years old and lives in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Nilda has a general store that sells a variety of products: soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for ten years. 

She requested a loan of three thousand Pesos to buy additional inventory for sale. Nilda has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Nilda hopes to have a brighter future and a satisfied family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en:
Lourn is fifty-one years old and a hard-working father who is in the business of trading firewood for sale. He is married to a local farmer and has been blessed with two single children, both of whom are currently students in high school. For Lourn, the most important thing is to provide his children with basic necessities such as food, clothes, shelter, and education. He wants to experience a quality of life, so he has strong commitment to work out his plan and improve his living standard.

Now Lourn is asking for a loan of the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to finish constructing his house. He will purchase some building materials and pay for the labor costs. He hopes to have a comfortable house, which will provide happiness to the family in their daily living.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials and pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman, aged 37 years, with 4 children aged between 2 and 15 years old. Three of them are school age and attend a nearby school.

She started a grocery using loan funds from Ugafode and has grown it to its current status since 2004. She works all the days of the week so that she can break even and satisfy her family demands.

She sells firewood to supplement the meager income. She has applied for UGX 2,000,000 to buy more stock for the grocery. Her dream is to build her own place of operation so that she can stop renting. Her main challenge is stiff competition in addition to limited capital. Fatuma is a very hardworking and good-natured lady.

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery

loans.name: Sorie Thomas' Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Binkolo, a village near Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, to request a loan of 10,300,000.00 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy or invest in things that their salaries alone do not allow. At the end of each month, these teachers repay SMT/Kiva lenders from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the salary deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Sorie, who is pictured in the middle, is the leader of this group. Sorie is forty-eight years old. He is a native of Kapethe village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has five children together who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sorie has been in the teaching profession for twenty-eight years now. He wants this loan to buy building materials like cement and corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a house

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is twenty-five years old and married with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling bananas and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy chicken leg quarters, banana, flour, oil and curry powder. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, bananas, flour, oil and curry powder.

loans.name: Failelei

texts.en: Failelei is twenty-five years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase resources to start up her business. In the future, Failelei hopes to extend and improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy resources to start a business including cooking oil, taro, plastic bags, cooking pot and a gas burner.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is fifty-two years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. Liliosa has a snack vending business particularly banana-q (deep fried bananas) and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be used in purchasing additional bananas and ingredients for her business. Liliosa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Liliosa hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas and ingredients.

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
Dot is 36 years old and a married woman who has been residing in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has a life partner, who is responsible and supportive in raising the family, and has two school-aged children. Her husband is able to make a better income than the one she gets from farming. He transports firewood he buys in bulk from his suppliers and sells in the marketplaces, earning around USD 4.00 per day on average. 

In this coming season, Dot will continually work on her farmland, planting potatoes for sale. However, due to the shortage of capital, she would like to obtain a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to pay for labor costs. She will hire laborers to prepare the land and till her soil. She hopes that she can have a sustainable financial success and raise her family out of poverty some day. In the future, Dot plans to send all of her children to a good university.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita is married and has three children. She is 65 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Warlita plants, harvests, and sells rice for a living. She has been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow. In 2010, Warlita joined GDMPC. In the future, Warlita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn, as well as other villagers, is engaged in the farming business. She grows rice and potatoes on her existing farmland in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has been in this business for almost 13 years and earns approximately 5 USD per day. Korn is 32 years old, widowed, and responsible for two school-age children.

With the loan she has requested from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, she would like to hire a few laborers to work on her potato plantation. Korn hopes that, with the help of the loan, she will be able to have a good harvest in the coming season. She will use her generated income to pay for her daily food, to reinvest into her business, and to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to hire a few laborers to work on her potato plantation.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analiza has been in this business for two years. Analiza earns additional income from raising pigs.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 43-year-old married woman with four children aged between four and ten. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Erna sells spices to her community. She also does retailing and repacking of calcium hydrochloride which is commonly used as a bleaching agent by most people.

Erna is requesting a loan to buy more garlic, onions and pepper to sell. She hopes to build a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more garlic, onions and pepper to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jugs of local beverage and bags of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en:
Germelina, who is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 44 years old, married, and has three children. For the past five years she has owned and operated a flower business, earning 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Germelina joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Bapak (Mr.) Eddy owns a cellular shop and  a small grocery stall in his neighborhood. In his modest shop, he sells Ruma’s airtime prepaid minutes, snacks (biscuits, fried crackers), drinks, candies, pens, pencils, and cigarettes. He is married and has four children. The age range of his children is very wide. His first child is 25 years old, then a set of twins who are 22 years old, and the last one is 12 years old. 

By having an EDC machine, Bapak Eddy wants to be able to do the transaction for bill payments from his shop. He expects that people will come to him to pay their monthly electric bill, buy electricity vouchers, pay monthly landline phone bills, and motorcycle installments. He is interested in Ruma’s new program because he can actually expand his business. His goals are to be successful and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Rebecca Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, to request a loan of 7,800,000.00  Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy or invest in things that their salaries alone do not allow. At the end of each month, these teachers repay SMT/Kiva lenders from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the salary deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Rebecca, who is pictured in the middle, is the leader of this group. Rebecca is fifty-two years old. She is a native of Masimby village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a lecturer and the couple has five children together.
Rebecca has been in the teaching profession for thirty-five years now. She wants this loan to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Fatmata H.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, to seek a loan of 18,100,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to invest in items that are beyond their salaries' limits. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf. 

The leader of this team is Fatmata, 57 years old. She is a native of Kambia, in northern Sierra Leone, and is married to a school supervisor. Fatmata has three children, two of whom are in tertiary institutions. Fatmata has been a professional teacher for thirty-two years. She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: Norberto es socio del Bancomunal Ccori Ayllu donde tiene el cargo de Secretario. Tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y es padre de 4 hijos. Es socio de FINCA Perú 9 años y es distribuidor de una reconocida empresa que se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina y ollas de acero quirúrgico, y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes junto a su esposa. Está agradecido con la institución por todas las facilidades de crédito que le brindan y que aprendió a ahorrar y eso es lo que más le gustó. Él dice que en las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseñan temas con los cuales una persona mejora su calidad de vida tanto en lo familiar y en lo laboral. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche) para su tienda que es un negocio que tiene junto a su esposa mientras él se dedica a la distribución y venta de utensilios.
texts.en: Norberto is a member of the communal bank Ccori Ayllu where he has the role of Secretary. He is 65 years old, married and the father of 4 children. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 9 years and is a distributor for a recognized business that sells kitchen utensils and pots of surgical steel, and he also has a grocery store with his wife. He is grateful to the institution for all the help with credit that they have provided and thankful that he learned to save -- that is what he liked best.  He says that in the trainings that he receives in his communal bank, they teach him subjects by which a person can improve their quality of life both in the context of family and in labor. The new loan that he is requesting will be invested in buying groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, milk) for his store, which is a business that he runs with his wife, while at the same time he is engaged in the distribution and sale of utensils.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (sugar, rice, noodles and milk) for his store.

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are civil servants from one of the government ministries in the northern city of Makeni. This group of civil servants has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, to seek a loan of 3,100,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to invest in items that are beyond their salaries limits. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan from their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.
 
The leader of this team is Lucy, 48 years old, pictured third from left. She is a native of Bo, Sierra Leone’s second city. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children who are in college. Lucy has been a professional teacher for 24 years. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like cements for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cements for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Nabia Amina

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Nabia Amina, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean leones in order to invest in her business. 

Nabia Amina sells biscuits, sugar, cold water, milk, mosquito repellants, cigarettes, etc.  A widow with four children, the 55 year old has been a businesswoman for 23 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar, cold water, milk, mosquito repellants, cigarettes, etc. in bulk to add to her grocery shop

loans.name: Dedeh

texts.en:
Dedeh is a forty-seven-year-old-lady and is married to Wahono, a fifty-nine year old man. Dedeh runs a business selling yellow rice, while Wahono runs a furniture business; Dedeh and husband are blessed with two children, namely: Julyada, twenty-three years old, who is a university student; Fajar, seven years old, who is attending second grade of elementary school.

Dedeh sells yellow rice in front of her house. She operates the business every day from 6 am to 11 am. The business has been running for more than four years and she has many customers. To ease her in serving the customers, Dedeh employs one person to assist her in cooking and selling yellow rice. Fried fish and chicken, egg, noodles, and “sambal” (chili) are the side dishes for the yellow rice. The income from the business is utilized to help her husband meet the living costs. 

At the moment, Dedeh is able to sell up to seven kilograms of rice in a day. She needs more capital to buy more food and spices but her money is insufficient due to the expenses of her daughter in the university, so she requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to purchase extra rice, eggs, and kitchen equipment i.e. a stove and frying pan. She is looking forward to seeing improvement in her business.

loans.use: to purchase extra rice and eggs and more kitchen equipment such as a stove and frying pan.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавчуде свойственны самые хорошие качества людей. С уверенностью можно описать ее как трудолюбивую, нравственно устойчивую, целенаправленную и мотивированную женщину. В течении 10 лет наряду с мужем дехканом, упорно трудясь,  она смогла обогатить свой семейный бюджет. Она занимается выращиванием и продажей огурцов, лука и дыни. Мавчуде позволяет ее здоровое физическое состояние работать на 2,55 га земли. Так как она всегда находиться в конкуренции с современным миром, она решила построить дом по новой планировки со всеми удобствами для своей большой и дружной семьи. Она собирается купить ДВП, ДСП и доски для строительства.
texts.en:
Mavluda embodies some of the best human qualities. She can be confidently described as a hard-working, morally stable, focused and motivated woman. Over the past 10 years, working hard together with her farmer husband, she was able to improve their family's well-being. Mavluda grows and sells cucumbers, onions and melons. Her good physical condition allows Mavluda to work 2.55 hectares of land.

As Mavluda is always in competition with today's world, she has decided to build a modern new house with all amenities for her large happy family. Using this loan, she plans to buy various lumber products for the construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her new home

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal la nueva esperanza esta conformado de nueve integrantes Amanda,Ely, Dominga, María, Maria Isabel, Jennifer, Meyling,Vilma y Gregoria. Todas se apoyan mutuamente. Ellas tienen mucho tiempo de dedicarse al comercio, por ejemplo Amanda del Socorro necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, desodorantes, entre otros y así poder surtir su venta .
texts.en: The communal bank "Nuevo Esperanza" is made up of 9 members: Amanda, Ely, Dominga, María, Maria Isabel, Jennifer, Meyling, Vilma and Gregoria.  They all support one another.  They have all been working in retail trade for some time now.  For example, Amanda del Socorro needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, deodorants, and other products so that she can stock her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, deodorants, and other products for her business

loans.name: Roga

texts.en:
Bapak (Mr.) Roga is a man who lives in the Bekasi area about one hour from Jakarta. He lives with his wife and 3 children (15 years old, 11 years old, and 4 years old). Currently, he owns a small grocery store. In his store, he sells  basic goods such as eggs, flour, shampoo, soap, drinks, tissues, cooking oil, snacks, and other household necessities. Other than household products, Bapak Roga sells airtirme prepaid minutes in his small store also. His dream is to expand the business with Ruma’s network. 

Basically, the reason he wants to become a Loket Ruma agent is because he wants his business to be more advanced and generate more income, of course, for the family. He hopes that people will come to him to pay their  monthly electricity bill, phone land line bill, certain prepaid "telcos", and water bills.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio, age 40, owns and operates a general store for a living. Eugenio has been in this business for about six years. He earns about PHP 3,000 a month. Eugenio lives in Mitugas, Tudela Misamis Occidental, with his wife and two children. 

In 2011, Eugenio joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. In the future, Eugenio plans to make an expansion to his store.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 24 años, su esposo es Pedro, con quien tiene dos hijos: Jefferson y Estefanía, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Rundo. 
Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura. Siembra papa y maíz en sus terrenos y en otros arrendados, pues a veces no abastece. Cada cosecha la comercializan en la ciudad, es el resultado de largos meses de arduo trabajo. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas y ovejas, las cuales vende después de engordarlas, si es que tiene alguna necesidad. Ahora desea juntar todo el dinero posible para poder comprar más terrenos agrícolas.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Rundo al progreso” y este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, pues las personas son responsables y solidarias.
Juana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes para su siembra de papa, también pagará el alquiler de los terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Juana is 24 years old, her husband is Pedro and together they have two children; Jefferson and Estefania, whom they take care of in their own home located in Rundo.
Her main activity is farming.  She grows potatoes and corn in her fields and also in others that she rents in times when her own are not enough.  She sells her harvest, which is the result of long months of hard work, in the city.  Since she is a very hard working woman she also raises cows and sheep, which she fattens up and then sells when necessary.  Currently she wants to get money together to buy more farm land.
She belong to the community bank "Rundo al Progreso" (Rundo to progress) and this is her 5th loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support that she has received all this time. She promises to make her repayments on time.  She is also very happy to be part of her group because the members are responsible and supportive. 
Juana will invest the requested money in the purchase of fertilizers for her potato harvest and will also pay the rent for the leased farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay rent on the land.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces de Compañía y tiene 34 años de edad es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de hortalizas  como zanahorias y lechugas para así poder venderlos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad. Por otra parte apoya a su esposo en el negocio de elaboración de ladrillos. Durante todo este tiempo como socia de la institución lo que mas le ha gustado es que aprendió a ahorrar, y que a través de las capacitaciones que recibe por parte de las promotoras de su Bancomunal aprende a  educar a sus hijos y también realizar inversiones adecuadas en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arcilla para la elaboración de ladrillos y otra parte para la compra de abonos para mantener el buen estado la siembra de las hortalizas.
texts.en: Gladys is a member of the communal bank " Los Sauces de Compañía."  She is 34 years old, lives with a partner, and has 4 children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 2 years, and she works cultivating and harvesting vegetables, such as carrots and lettuce, which she sells in the various markets in the city.  She also supports her husband in his business making bricks.  Over the time she has been a member of the institution, what she has liked the most is learning to save, and through the training that she receives from the loan officers of her communal bank, she has learned how to educate her children and also make appropriate investments in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of clay to make bricks, and also to purchase fertilizers to maintain her vegetable crops in good condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain her vegetable crops in good condition

loans.name: Woso Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Woso” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of  500,000.00 Sierra Leonean leones for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The twenty-five-year-old is married to a motorbike taxi driver and they have two school-going children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for three years now, she sells “woso” (a local substance with medicinal value).  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of woso to add to her business.

loans.use: to  buy a large quantity of "woso" to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap metal in large quantities to be resold.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is fifty-two years old, married, and has four children. She manages a gardening business for a living. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Nenita joined GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 43 years old and is a married woman with nine children aged between nine and twenty-four. Erlinda sells purified water to her community in Talibon, Bohol. She also sells bags, men and women's shirts and accessories. She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. Erlinda works hard to increase her income and sustain her children's education. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as bags, shirts and purified water. Erlinda hopes for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as bags, shirts and purified water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, She previously availed herself of a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fish and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan to pay for fish, meat and vegetables supplies she needs in her business. The more fish, meat and vegetables displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Corazon hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a 50-year-old married woman with two children ages 17 and 20. She supports her family through seaweed farming. She currently needs additional capital for her business. She is in need of seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. Felicidad hopes to have sufficient income to pay her children's school fees. She also hopes to help elevate her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita  is  32  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Lucita  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for five  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Lucita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to use in repairing cellphones

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene la actividad económica de pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio  surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para su familia .Nicasio siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, pues siempre está esforzándose para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita por lo que es así que su negocio ha podido mejorar así podrá comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes, sopas y granos básicos.
texts.en: Nicasio Antonio has a store as his primary economic activity.  He has been in business for more than seven years, and he began because of the necessity of providing an income to support his family.  Nicasio has always been a very responsible man, and he is always striving to improve their quality of life. This is not the first funding request he has made, so his business has been improved.  With this loan he will be able to buy candy, natural drinks, juices, detergents, soups, and grains.

loans.use: to buy sweets, natural beverages, juices, detergents, soups, and basic grains and legumes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Bancomunal Orcasitas II y tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de Finca Perú hace 10 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. Le gusta ser parte de su Bancomunal ya que se distrae y comparte experiencias entre las socias, y sobre todo aprende mucho con las capacitaciones que recibe allí, ella comenta que son lecciones para la vida sobre todo si las pones en práctica. Gracias a las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece FINCA logró el acabado de su vivienda y el incremento de su negocio. Su meta como toda madre es brindar una educación profesional a sus hijos.El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes  para su tienda y así aumentar más sus ganancias.
texts.en: Paulina is a member of the Orcasitas II community bank.  She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years and owns a grocery store.  She likes being a member of her community bank because she enjoys herself and shares experiences with her fellow group members.  Above all, she learns a lot from the training that she receives there.  She comments that they are life lessons, above all if you put them into practice.  Thanks to FINCA's loans, she has been able to finish building her home and increase her business.  Her goal, in common with that of all mothers, is to provide her children with a college education.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries for her store so that she can further increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store so that she can further increase her profits

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Bancomunal Orcasitas II  y tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 14 años  y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, por otra parte se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella con todo su esfuerzo logró comprar un vehículo que le ayuda en el transporte de mercadería. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal donde aprende muchas cosas que le ayudan mejorar en su negocio y en su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.
texts.en: Lidia is member of the community bank Orcasitas II, is 49 years old, a widow and mother of 7 children.  She has been a member if Finca Peru for 14 years and makes a living producing and selling bricks.  She also sells food. Through her hard work, she has been able to acquire a vehicle that helps her to transport her merchandise.  She likes the training that she gets at the community bank where she learns many things that help her to improve her business and her family.  The loan that she requests she will use to maintain her vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is the mother of one child. She owns a retail shop which has been in operation for five years and has been a source of constant income to the family. In this shop, she sells cereals, sugar, cooking oil and kerosene among other things. Besides this business, Peris also owns a grocery stall.

She learnt of Milango from a company employee and joined in order to access credit for her business. Peris is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, kerosene etc and renovate the shop.

Peris believes she can then be able to provide for her family’s basic needs more easily. Peris’s desire is to grow her business into a wholesale. She is full of praise to Milango for all this assistance. The only challenge that Peris faces is the inflation.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. cereals, sugar, cooking fat, kerosene.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh is a married woman with four single children. She is now 42 years old and resides with her children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is operating a farming business, primarily growing rice and potatoes for sale. She has been 10 years in this type of business, from which she is able to cover her daily expenses and send all of her children to school. She has become a single mother and strives to work hard to fight against poverty.

She has requested a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to pay for labor costs, for people who will work on her potato plantation. She would like to thank in advance Kiva lenders and HKL, which allow her to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She hopes that she can obtain a high production and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is a 37-year-old married woman with two children ages 2 and 7. She owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store in Talibon, Bohol. She sells snack foods, toiletries and canned goods. She also provides prepaid mobile credit load to her community. 

Analou is able to support her family's daily needs. She hopes for her income to increase so she is able to save for her children's education. She has requested a loan to buy more canned goods, toiletries and other items to sell. This loan will help increase Analou's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, toiletries and other items to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
46-year-old Angelita owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has four children ages 8, 11, 13 and 16. Her husband is a fisherman.

Angelita has had her store for 10 years now. She earns 15,000 PHP per month selling soft drinks, canned goods and toiletries to her community. Angelita works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs and send her children to school. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods and toiletries. Angelita hopes to have sufficient income to sustain her children's education. She hopes to have them finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods and toiletries

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rubylyn dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana Modesta

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Orcasitas II y tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla. Durante todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar e invertir de manera adecuada en su negocio. Está agradecida con la institución, asistiendo a las reuniones conoció a muchas amigas con las que comparte  experiencias  en lo laboral y personal. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones  que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que le enseñan temas que le dejan buenos aprendizajes y luego las pone en práctica todas las lecciones aprendidas. 
Se encuentra muy feliz ya que logró comprar 2 taxis que ahora son conducidos por su esposo e hijo y así ellos generan sus propios ingresos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tara y cochinilla y la otra parte en el mantenimiento de sus vehículos.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the communal bank "Orcasitas II."  She is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years, and she has a business buying and selling cochineal and tara (a tannin which comes from a native plant). Over the time she has been a member of FINCA Peru, she has learned to save and how to invest appropriately in her business.  She is grateful to the institution, because through attending the meetings she has gotten to know many friends with whom she shares both work and personal experiences.  She really likes the training that she receives in her communal bank, because they teach her about topics that educate her, and which she can later put into practice.  She is very happy because she has already managed to buy 2 taxis that are now driven by her husband and her son, allowing them to generate their own income.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of tara and cochineal, and she will also use part of the loan to maintain her vehicles.

loans.use: to buy tara and cochineal, and also to maintain her vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, bathing suits, socks, underwear,and other clothing.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
This is Aurea, 51, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Sammy, a salesman. She is the mother of four children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Aurea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling the items by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aurea hopes her business would grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a 42-year-old married woman living in Punta, Panaon, Philippines. She has 2 kids who have assisted her sometimes in the feeding and caring of the animals. The small piggery she is working on at this time commenced 5 years ago. While not the only source of income, Roselyn earns a total of about PHP 25,000 a month. Roselyn joined GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase feeding supplies for piglets. She wants to give the best possible nourishment to them so as not to be hesitant in naming the price when selling them. The profit to generate from this investment is planned for buying more piglets to gain more income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for piglets.

loans.name: Maria Marieta

texts.en:
This is Maria Marietta, 40, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Gerry, a traffic aid. She has two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Maria Marietta operates a food stall. She sells snacks like fish balls, hotdog, fruits and other street food staples and also manage a small variety store in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 11, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of street food products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Marietta dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of food supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
46-year-old Rosela is a married woman with 3 children ages 9, 15 and 21. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Rosela owns and manages a beauty salon in Talibon, Bohol. She works hard to give the best service and keep her customers loyal. She is requesting a loan to purchase hair color, hot oil and other supplies. Rosela hopes her income will increase and that she will be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase hair color, hot oil and other supplies.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum is resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 43 years old and a married woman with four single children living together under the same roof. She and her husband work hard to help their children achieve their desires in life. Sum is involved in farming business and also devotes some time to run a small store selling grocery items and home use products for additional income. She has been involved in this for almost 13 years.

Sum is requesting a KHR 1,500,000 loan to add to her capital to purchase potato trees for planting and fertilizers for the good care of her crops. She hopes to receive the loan and maintain her business as a source of income. In the future, Sum wants to be a successful entrepreneur and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase potato trees for planting and fertilizers for the good care of her crops.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 53 years old and lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. She is married to a fisherman and they have five children aged between 10 and 22 years. Catalina has had a sari-sari (variety) store for two years. She earns about 7000 PHP per month selling eggs, snack foods, soft drinks and canned goods. 

Catalina is working hard to help provide for her family's needs and to sustain her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks. Catalina hopes for her loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Chandrina

texts.en: Chandrina is 33 years old and is a married woman with a 7-year-old child. She supports her family through her sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells school supplies, snack foods, canned goods and spices to her community. She works hard to send her child to school. She hopes to increase her income and be able to save more. She has requested a loan to buy additional items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods. This loan will help increase Chandrina's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang, age 54, is an entrepreneurial woman who has strong determination to aspire to something better for her family. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, who is also her business partner, and she has given birth to two children who are attending school and still need her support. 

Eang and her husband help each other in their farming business to ensure a standard of living and achieve their goal. In addition, Eang has operated a small store from her home and sells grocery items, spices, home use products, and soft drinks to satisfy her customers in the community. She wanted to increase the kinds of products she sells in her village, but she did not have enough capital to do it. In this connection, Eang wishes for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store and increase her merchandise. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to develop her business. And she hopes that she can see her children grow up and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old, married and a mother of two sons and a daughter. Her sons do work while her daughter is studying.

Her husband is an auto mechanic. He has great technical skills and uses his skills very efficiently to provide quality auto repair services to his clients. Salma is also a working lady. She sells buffalo milk to her community clients. She also knows the art of sewing and sews if she receives any orders.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her dairy business. With the loan investment she will buy another buffalo that will help her get larger quantity of milk and increase her sales and profits. She is very experienced in her work and confident that her business will get more success by investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Salma.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: York

texts.en:
York is a 37-year-old married woman who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has four children attending school and needs to pay for their daily allowances. She is in the business of cultivating rice, potatoes, and vegetables to generate a livelihood. She has been engaged in the business for more than 10 years. She wants to improve her business and earn consistent profits to secure the family, especially for the education of their children.

She is now asking for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for home use. With a portion of the loan she will buy zinc to re-tile her roof because the old tiles are broken. In the future, she hopes to improve her farming business and maintain a good growth and also to continuously educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Lilian es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces de Compañía y tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, negocio que comparte con su conviviente. Lo que mas le gusta de la institución es que le enseñaron a ahorrar y también las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal que son muy buenas ya que le enseñan a vivir mejor y saber invertir su dinero. Ella logró construir su horno para la fabricación de ladrillos. Está agradecida con FINCA Perú por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Su meta es tener una ferretería para que así pueda vender más de sus ladrillos entre otras cosas más. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tierra para que así sigua produciendo más ladrillos.
texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Bancomunal (community bank) "Los Sauces de Compañía," and she is 22 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 3 years, and is involved in making and selling bricks, a business she shares with her partner. What she likes best about the institution is how it has taught her how to save money, and also the workshops she receives at her community bank, which are very good and teach her to live better and know how to invest her money.

She was recently able to build a furnace for the manufacture of bricks. She is grateful to FINCA Peru for the loan options offered. Her goal is to have a hardware store so that she will be able to sell more of her bricks and other items. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of land in order to continue producing more bricks.

loans.use: to buy land in order to continue producing more bricks.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia continua en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,ella vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia es una persona alegre y carismatica con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como leche.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Member Zoraida still works at her grocery store. She sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and other products. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She is a cheerful and charismatic person and she is very eager to continue moving forward for her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise for her business, such as milk.

She is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to complying with her installment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, such as milk.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Claris was employed and after saving some money, she added it onto the contribution from her husband as the startup capital for the current business. She now owns a food café which has been in operation for three years.
Claris was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase more charcoal and food stock for the café. Her aspiration is to open a restaurant in the near future.
Claris will use the additional income from this loan to purchase chairs for the café as part of her plan of expanding the sitting capacity of the café.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and food stock.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de tres hijos (dos hijos varones y una nena). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y se dedica a la venta de adornos y decoraciones en general sobre todo adornos navideños y también adornos para Semana Santa, y adicionalmente vende ropa. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo ha aprendido a ahorrar y sobre todo a compartir y ser solidaria que es lo que más aprecia de FINCA Perú. Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como adornos, decoraciones y ropa.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 31, is a member of Capuli Communal Bank.  She lives with her partner and is the mother of three children (two boys and a girl).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years and works selling a variety of ornaments and decorations, especially Christmas ornaments and decorations for Holy Week.  She also sells clothing.

She says that in all this time she has learned to save and to share and be supportive, which is what she appreciates most about FINCA Peru.  Her dream for the future is to build her own house.

She is going to invest the loan she is requesting in buying merchandise for her business, such as ornaments, decorations, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as ornaments, decorations, and clothing.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es:
José continúa trabajando en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos plásticos, el cual son bien demandados, lo que está contento porque,  ha aumentado la cantidad en compra y venta, su esposa lo apoya, como objetivo  a futuro es tener su propio terreno y casa, viven a parte donde su suegro, ha hecho mejora al local que vive, pero su objetivo tener su propio terreno
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá producto para su negocio 300 bultos de empaque para comida, 35 caja de platos desechables, 20 cajas de cucharas, 5 cajas de bolsa desechable y otros como, pajillas, servilletas, con el fin de seguir promoviendo su inversión, captando clientela y tener a sus clientes estables al entregarle mercadería.
texts.en:
José continues to work in his small business selling plastic products, which are in high demand, which pleases him, since he has increased the amount he is buying and selling.  His wife supports him, and his goal for the future is to have his own land and house.  They currently live on a piece of land where his father-in-law has made improvements to the place, but his goal to have his own land.

With this new loan, he will invest in products for his business, including 300 packages of food packaging, 35 boxes of disposable plates, 20 boxes of spoons, 5 boxes of disposable bags, and other products, such as straws and napkins, with the end goal of further developing his investment, attracting new customers and keeping his established customer base by delivering their merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in plastic products like plates, glasses, spoons, forks, and items for packaging foods.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio Porfirio, continua con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar y leche,el socio lleva buen tiempo con este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio , a la vez el socio continua trabajando en costruccion de diferentes obras que le solicitan , siendo de esta manera que le socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estbalecidas.
texts.en:
Member Porfirio is still in business selling essential goods, such as rice, sugar, and milk. He has been in this business for a good while and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business. At the same time, he continues to work different construction jobs that request him, which is how he provides for his family.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise for his business, such as rice.

He is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to complying with his installment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business, such as rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheets, cosmetics, clothing in general, glasses, hats, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón es un hombre de negocios, sabe bien lo quiere y eso es ampliar su negocio. El vende tortas en su carrito que es manipulado por una moto al frente, le va muy bien con la venta de tortas, además vende flautas y con este negocio da empleo a dos jóvenes, pero eso no es todo, también es carpintero y dice ser de los mejores. Lo vamos apoyar para que sus ingresos crezcan y su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Simón is a businessman who knows just what he wants, and that is to increase his business.  He sells tortas (traditional Mexican sandwiches) in his food cart, which is driven by a motor in the front.  Things are going very well for him in the sales of tortas.  

In addition, he sells flutes, and with this other business, he is able to employ two young men, but that's not all... also, he is a carpenter and said to be one of the best.  We hope you will support him so that his sales will increase and his quality of life can improve.

loans.use: to remodel his food cart.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 67 años de edad, conviviente y con 1 hijos, domicilia en el norte del Peru y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica. Simon se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería contando con 4,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente. Ademas su ganado tiene ovinos y credos, cuenta con mas de 12 años en su negocio, su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades.

El tiene pensado invertir el prestamo en la compra de fertilizantes para cultivo de limón, ademas para realizar labores de limpieza del campo lo cual le permitirá lograr una mejor producción y  mejorar su calidad de vida. Simon es un cliente recurrente y ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Simon, 67, lives with a partner and has a child.  He resides in northern Peru, where the only utility he has is electricity.  Simon is a farmer who has 4 hectares of agricultural land that is planted with limes, which he harvests weekly.  He also raises livestock such as sheep and pigs.  He has been doing this work for more than 12 years, and his partner supports him in these activities.

He is planning on investing this loan in the purchase of fertilizers for his lime crops, and also to clear some of his land, which will allow him to increase his production and improve his quality of life.  Simon is a repeat client, and he has demonstrated himself to be very responsible with his payments.

loans.use: to improve the productivity of his crops through the purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Loeung is 49 years old, a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married but at present she has become a single mother of two school-aged children. She is a very hard-working mother who owns and manages a farming business to support the family and educate her children. She has been in this business for more than 24 years, earning approximately USD 4.50 each day.

Loeung wants to expand her business, but unfortunately she suffers from financial constraints. This is why she decided to request a loan of KHR 1,300,000 to hire laborers to take care of her potato crop and transplant her rice. She is very confident that this loan will allow her to earn higher profits and to offer a better future to her family. She plans to purchase extra plots of land to expand and increase her production in years to come.

loans.use: to hire laborers to take care of her potato crop and transplant her rice.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio Percy continua trabajando en su consultorio ya son varios años dedicandose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo,el socio es una persona empeñosa y carismatica siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia
El socio solicita el prestamo para el mantenimiento de su computadora.


El socio Percy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Percy continues to work in his office, where he has been for many years, which has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is an earnest and charismatic person, and with this work he is able to help his family get ahead in life.

He is asking for this loan in order to do maintenance work on his computer.  Percy is glad of the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to service and upgrade his computer.

loans.name: Candida Azucena

texts.es: Cándida Azucena esta emprendedora tiene  por actividad económica servicio musicales ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual es contratado por los ciudadanos de su localidad, cándida ha tenido créditos anteriores con fundación la cual ha demostrado ser trabajadora, responsable, con solvencia de pago,  el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar
texts.en: Cándida Azucena is an entrepreneur whose business activity is offering music services from her home to locals in her city, who hire her. Cándida has received previous loans through our foundation and has proved herself to be hardworking, responsible, and solvent in her payments. She wants financing in order to purchase new music equipment so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to purchase new music equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy hacendosa que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Reynaldo, de 26 años, y su querido hijo Benjer de 2 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se despierta, cada día, muy temprano para preparar los alimentos de su familia y luego se dirige a su puesto de ventas ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Tiene un puesto de abarrotes y verduras, y gracias a su carisma y la amabilidad de su trato es la preferida por sus clientes, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos que tiene su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 2 meses en esta actividad, y a pesar del poco tiempo considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. 

Con los 2,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más mercaderías en arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, verduras, pollo  y otros comestibles.
texts.en:
Delia, 27, is a very industrious woman who lives with her partner, Reynaldo, 26, and their dear son, Benjer, 2, in a rented house-they want to give their son a better quality of life.

Delia wakes up very early every day to prepare food for her family and then goes to her stand in the market where she lives.  She has a stand for groceries and vegetables and thanks to her charisma and congeniality in the way she treats her customers, they will always buy from her knowing that she has a big variety of products.  What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She has had this business for 2 months and despite the short time she has had it, she considers the most difficult part to be having to stand on her feet all day.

She will use the 2500 new sols requested to buy more merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods, vegetables and more food.

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her stand

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina is a 53-year-old woman and is married to Samuel, who is 56 years old. They have six children between the ages of 27 and 14 years old. The children's names are: Septi, Nehemia, Oba, Jonas, Denny and Lena. Adolfina owns a coconut oil production business. The coconuts are taken from her farm and are processed to become coconut oil. The oil is then sold at the local market in her village; Friday is market day. She has to travel 25 kilometers to reach the market. Adolfina has been running the business for more than 10 years. The business is her main source of income as it enables her to cover her family's living costs and her children's school expenses.

At the moment, Adolfina has received many coconut oil orders but unfortunately she does not have a coconut rasping machine to speed up the production process. Adolfina has always produced the coconut oil by using traditional tools and it takes time to produce the oil. Therefore, Adolfina is requesting a loan of IDR5,000,000 to buy a new coconut rasping machine.

loans.use: to buy a new coconut rasping machine.

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s dairy business. With the loan investment he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk for selling to his community clients and increase his sales and income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Rasheedan is confident that the loan will be a productive one for him.

Rasheedan also provides full support to her husband in his business and takes care of the livestock. She gives them food on time and keeps their living place clean. She has given birth to seven children. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. Rasheedan knows the importance of education very well and wants her children to become successful in life by getting quality education.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Rasheedan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay is 43 years old. He is married to a local farmer and was blessed with four single children who still need his support. He and his wife are raising their family in a peaceful village, in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. This couple plants and harvests particularly rice for their daily sustenance as well as for sale. Chay wants to sustain his business and make a stable income, so that he will be able to educate his children and give them a better life. 

Due to financial constraints, Chay is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 in order to pay the labor costs incurred in plowing his soil. He believes that this loan will help him maintain a good growth of his business and he will have a fruitful harvest in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs incurred in plowing his soil.

loans.name: Lkhagvesuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 57, lives with his wife in a 'ger' (slum) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They own a small wooden house and plot of land. His wife is a pensioner and looks after the house. Mr. Lkhagvasuren runs a small business which helps foreign citizens and tourists coming to Mongolia. He takes his clients around the city, showing all sights and places of interest using his car. He has been doing this business for a while and has a very good experience in guiding and transporting the clients. He is very reliable and a knowledgeable person.

Lkhagvesuren has an only daughter who is grown up and lives separately with her family. Lkhagvasuren loves his daughter very much and always helps and supports his daughter and her family financially and by whatever means he can. Recently his daughter bought an old house which needs some restoration. With the money borrowed from Credit Mongol, Lkhagvasuren wants to buy building materials such as insulation materials, bricks, wood planks, paint, cement, new plumbing pipes and make his daughter's house well insulated from the winter cold and more energy efficient by insulating it. As you know, Ulaanbaatar city is one of the coldest capital cities in the World. The money will be used to restore his only daughter’s old house and to make it more energy efficient and warm.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as insulation materials, bricks, wood planks, paint, cement, new plumbing pipes and to make his daughter's house well insulated from the winter cold and more energy efficient

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Moun operates a farming business to generate income. She is 29 years old and has two school-aged children, residing with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. The farming business is the main source of the family’s income, which she uses for her daily food and allowances for her children. 

Moun aims to improve her farming business, make it more profitable, and reduce some unnecessary costs incurred in her business. Consequently, she is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase two cows for farming purposes. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her income if she strives to work harder. She wants to use the generated income for the future expansion of her business and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Mirjael Jonatan

texts.es:
Mirjael tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y sin Hijos. Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el norte del pais en donde practica sus actividades de ganadería. El se especializa en la crianza de ovinos, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales criá engorda y comercializa en el mercado local. Ademas, se dedica a labores agrícolas, su madre lo apoya en sus actividades y se dedica a la agricultura.

El destino del crédito será la compra de alimentos para el engorde de ganado y ademas para compra de ganado para el engorde y venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local. El cuenta con mas de 6 años en su negocio y previamente ha utilizado los servicios del Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mirjael is 25 years old, lives with his partner, and has no children. He lives in his own house, which is located in the northen region of the country, where he works raising livestock. He specializes in raising sheep, pigs, and fowl, which he raises, fattens, and sells at the local market. He also does agricultural work. His mother supports him in his business and works in agriculture.

The loan will be used to purchase feed to fatten his animals and also to purchase livestock to be fattened and sold at the local market at a better price. He has over six years of experience in his business and has previously used the services of Edpyme Alternativa with Kiva's support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 37, is a loving mother who is responsible for two teenaged children that are enrolled at school. Chea pays her full attention to her farming business, generating the income to support the family. Usually, she grows rice, potatoes, beans, and various kinds of vegetables based on the season and the needs of the marketplace. She has been engaged in this type of business for almost 10 years with a great support from her helpful husband. 

With the loan of KHR 1,500,000, Chea would like to pay for labor costs. She will hire the laborers to take out all unwanted plants from the potato field and take care of her crops. This will be her first loan, which will help Chea in improving her business. She is confident she will pay her loan back punctually with her generated income. She is very thankful to the kind lenders.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Nhes' Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Nhes is aged 50 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. To support the family, Nhes and his wife earn a living as rice farmers in the village and they have been involved in this business for almost thirty years. To better support his family, he also is a local TV and cassette player mechanic. 

Nhes’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and he is a second-loan client while his group member is with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the first time. The first loan from VisionFund has helped Nhes's family better support their daily lives and children’s studies. With his current business, he is able to earn around 18,000 KHR per day. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Nhes, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, aged 51, is a married mother of nine children, four of whom are dependent children and some of whom are still in school. Heng and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and planting cassava for ten years to support the big family. With the current business, she can earn around 17,000 KHR per day to spend for daily basic needs. 

This is Heng’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she and three other members are second cycle clients while the other one is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. She has used the first loan from VisionFund successfully and she can better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Heng, who is the leader, will use her portion to purchase fertilizers and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for her pumping machine to carry water into her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and increase crop yields to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and gasoline for her pumping machine

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
SAUL TIENE 24 AÑOS, ES CONVIVIENTE,  Y CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO, POR SU LABOR DE SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO MOTOTAXI. VIVE CON SU CONYUGE QUE ESTA EMBARASADA DE 4 MESES EN UNA CASA HUBICADA AL NORTE DEL PAIS. 

EL SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO DE MOTOTAXI DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS EN SU REGION.CON EL CRÉDITO REALIZARA CAMBIO DE LLANTAS A SU VEHICULO (MOTOTAXI) Y ARRASTE PARA SU MEJOR USO PARA USO PARA BRINDAR UN BUEN SERVICIO, ADEMAS DEL ARREGLO DE SU DOMICILIO (CUARTOS) PARA UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.  EL ES UNA PERSONA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS. FAMILIA UNIDA Y ESTE ESFUERZO ES PRECISAMENTE EL REFLEJO DE LAS NECESIDADES QUE AFRONTARA SU FAMILIA CUANDO NASCA EL BEBE. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA.
texts.en:
Saul is 24 years old, and is in a common-law marriage. He is known in his area for his work in public transportation services by mototaxi. He lives with his wife, who is four months pregnant, in a house located in the northern region of the country.

He has been working in public transportation services by mototaxi for three years in his region. He will use the loan to change the tires and the hauling system on his vehicle (mototaxi) so that it works better and he can offer a good service, as well as to fix up his home (bedrooms) for a better quality of life. He has good references and has a close family. Actually, this effort is in anticipation of the needs his family will face once the baby is born.

He lives in a community where there is trade, agriculture, and stockbreeding.

loans.use: to change the tires and hauling system on his vehicle (mototaxi).

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
