Se dedica a la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 6.09 has de terreno agrícola en la cual tiene 3.0 has de mango Kent en producción. También cuenta con 2.0 has de terreno agrícola en donde siembra maíz y frijol. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 25 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería. El destino del crédito será para el abonamiento y fertilización del cultivo de mango. Este es su segundo prestamo con Edpyme Alternativa que sera utilizado con fines similares el cual fue muy exitoso para las dos partes.
texts.en: Antonio is an existing client.  He is 67 years old, married, and has one child in his care.  He lives in his own home together with his wife and child.  Antonio is a farmer.  He has 6.09 hectares of farmland.  He is growing Kent mangoes on 3 hectares of his land.  On another 2 hectares he grows corn and beans.  In addition to this, he also raises animals which he sells in the local market once they reach an ideal size and weight.  Antonio has 25 years experience in farming and livestock raising.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his mango crops.  This is his second loan from Edpyme Alternativa and it will be used for similar purposes to his last one which was very successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his mango crops

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est marié å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant de trois ans qui va à l’école. 
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des mèches, des tissages et des chaussures pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Ayélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages et des chaussures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayélé voudrait développer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 27-year-old woman, and is married to a reseller. She has one child, who is aged three and goes to school.

Ayélé has worked as a reseller since 2010, and sells hair extensions, weaves and shoes to all the customers who come to her store. She buys her products in Lomé, and works alone. Her main difficulty is currently the fact that she cannot meet the needs of all her customers.

Ayélé has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions, weaves and shoes. She plans to reinvest in her business. Over the coming years she would like to develop her business, and says that she plans to use her profits to provide for her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, weaves and shoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells plantains, rice and soap at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for six years. Efua is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband in the feeding and clothing of their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of soup to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and boxes of soup to sell.

loans.name: Azer

texts.ru: Azer 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Azer jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. Azer uje 15 let kak zanimayetsya etim isskustvom kotoraya privratilas v yego rabotu. Azer iz dereva delayet razniye krasiviyi chasi, ukrasheniya dlya doma, ramki i t.d . On mojet zdelat iz dereva mnogo raznix krasivix izdeliy. Etu svoyu ruchnuyu rabotu on prodayot raznim magazinam , a takje v svoyom masterskom. No Seychas Azer nujdayetsya v 2350 AZN chtobi kupit materili dlya yego raboti v osobennosti on nujdayetsya kupit derevo dlya izdeliy. Etomu delu Azer nauchilsya u svoyego otca eto u nix nasledstvenniy dar a takje ix rabota.
texts.en:
Azer is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives in the Baku region together with his happy family. Azer is a very hard-working man. For the past 15 years, he has been engaged in the art which has become his profession - carving exquisite wooden clocks, home decorations, frames, etc. He can create many different beautiful items out of wood. He sells his handiwork to various stores, as well as directly from his workshop. It was Azer's father who taught him this craft, which is both their profession and their legacy.

Presently, Azer needs 2350 AZN to buy materials necessary for his work, particularly wood for his creations.

loans.use: to buy materials for his woodcarving business

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.ru: Fizuli uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya jivotnovodstvom i razvodit ovec. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Fizuli 42 qoda. Ranshe on razvodil korov, no posle togo kak on prodal svoi korovi on reshil razvodit ovec. Fizuli seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Fuzuli jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On v budushem xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichit svoi mesachniye doxodi.
texts.en: Fizuli is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in the Baku region together with his family. Fizuli has been an animal farmer for the past 7 years. Previously, he kept cattle, but then sold all his cows and now raises sheep. Presently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase more sheep in order to increase the size of his herd. In the future, Fizuli would like to expand his business and increase his monthly profits.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es:
YASENIA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, DE ESTADO CIVIL SEPARADA, TIENE 1 HIJA DE 4 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA EN OLMOS AL NORTRTE DEL PERU. EL POBLADO NO TIENE SERVICIO DE ENERGIA ELECTRICA NI AGUA POTABLE, LOS HABITANTES SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES (OVEJAS, CHIVO, GALLINAS, CERDOS, GANADO). AUNQUE ESTAR SEPARADA PUEDE SER UNA SITUACION DESVENTAJOSA EN ESTA REGION ELLA QUIERE SALIR ADELANTE E INVERTIR EN SU ACTIVIDAD PARA DARLE UN MEJOR BIENESTAR A SU HIJA.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMERCIALIZACION DE ANIMALES (OVEJOS, CABRITOS, GALLINAS, PAVOS, CERDOS), SEGUN EL PRECIO QUE LOS COMPRE, YA TIENE MAS DE 02 AÑOS DE antigüedad EN ESTE NEGOCIO, SUS COMPRAS LO REALIZA EN LOS ALREDEDORES DEL CPM. DE MOCAPE Y LAS VENTAS LO HACE EN LA CIUDAD DE CHICLAYO Y OMOS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA INVERTIR MAS CANTIDAD EN EL COMERCIO E ESTOS ANIMALES PARA ASI TENENR MEJORES GANANCIAS Y PODER INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS COMO INVENTARIO.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 22 years old, separated, and has a 4-year-old daughter.  She lives in her own home, in Olmos, in the north of Peru.  Her village does not receive electricity or drinking water.  The locals work in farming and livestock raising (sheep, goats, hens, pigs and cattle).  Although being separated can be a disadvantageous situation in this region, Yesenia would like to do well and invest in her business so that she can better provide for her daughter's welfare.

Yesenia sells animals (sheep, goats, hens, turkeys and pigs) in accordance with the price she buys them for.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  She makes her purchases on the outskirts of Mocape village and makes her sales in the cities of Chiclayo and Olmos.  She will invest her loan in buying more animals for her business so that she can make better profits and increase both her sales and inventory.

loans.use: to invest in buying more animals for her business so that she can make better profits

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité esta compuesto por 10 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se han unido con el ideal de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, Blanca, está acompañada con el Sr.  Ramón tiene 1  hijo. Blanca se dedica a la venta de ropa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar,  se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda seguir creciendo y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, y de esa forma poder tener un buen stock de prendas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee has 10 members.  They are all friends and neighbors who joined together so that they could work together and help their families.

One of the members of this group is Blanca.  She lives with Ramón and has one child.  Blanca's business is selling clothing.  She uses the income that she makes to help her husband with their household expenses.  She joined her neighborhood committee so that, with the help provided by Fundación Paraguaya, she could continue growing and helping her family.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing so that she can have a good stock of clothes available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en: Shakeela is a seamstress; she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number orders every month. The income she earns helps her to pay her utility bills. She has given birth to a son and a daughter, but due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her husband sells decorative items, sceneries (pictures of beautiful places), at different shops in the market. Shakeela has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy sceneries to sell for a profit. He has been operating his business for many years and Shakeela is hopeful that the loan will help her husband further his business.

loans.use: to buy decorative items, sceneries (pictures of beuatiful places), to sell.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Expedito” es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 13 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se unieron para poder ayudarse y también poder ayudar a sus familias.
Josefa se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y cuenta que es gracias a este trabajo, sumado a su esfuerzo y sacrificio que ha podido crecer como persona y como profesional. Ella sueña con poder tener un gran local y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que tiene un buen pedido de ellas y quiere poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The “San Expedito” committee is from the city of Santaní.  It has 13 [female] members who are very hard working and entrepreneurial.  They joined together so that they could help each other and also help their families.

Josefa's business is selling all kinds of clothing.  She says that, thanks to her work, effort and sacrifice, she has been able to grow as a person and also as a professional.  She dreams of having businesses premises where she can continue offering good products to her customers.

Josefa is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing as she has a good order for these goods and would like to be able to fill it.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo ella habilito un bar en su domicilio de los prestamos que fundación paraguaya le otorgo, hoy día su negocio ha crecido debido al empeño que le puso. Su deseo es seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que el crédito le ha servido de mucho, para la apertura de su bar y para que sus hijos hayan podido terminar su colegio y siga una carrera.
Ella solicita nuevamente la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para poder abastecer su bar con bebida de todo tipo, ya que siempre tiene mucha demanda y quiere poder cumplir con ellas.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) committee was formed as a result of some promotional work that was carried out in their neighborhood.  All of the group's members are from the same area.  They are acquaintances and neighbors.  The aims of each and every member are to work, foster a supportive spirit, and reach the maximum level of the program.

Petrona is the president of this group.  She used loans from Fundación Paraguaya to set up a bar in her home.  Her business has grown through the hard work that she has put in.  Her wish is to continue working with Fundación  Paraguaya as their loans have been very helpful to her in terms of opening her bar and enabling her children to finish school and study at college. 

Petrona is requesting Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva's help again so that she can stock her bar with all kinds of drinks because she always has a lot of demand and she would like to be able to meet it.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her bar

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
This is Crisanta, 50, a  resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Bonifacio, her business partner, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Crisanta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Crisanta dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 40, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

She plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and now earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Andrea has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 8,100 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Rose Gen

texts.en:
Rose Gen is married and works hard to support her family. 

She has a food business in the Philippines. Rose Gen has been in this business for three years now, and she also earns additional income from her general store.

Rose Gen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy pork, chicken and ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Rose Gen would like to save enough money to build and expand her general store.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario habitante de la  colonia La Union, trabaja como pequeño productor en la zona donde habita, solicita su 7mo crédito con el ojetivo de establecer unas manzanas para siembra de tuberculos y si alcanza para compra de semilla mejorada, y asegurar la alimentación de su inventario ganadero en tiempo de verano y la producción de leche y carne, y posteriormente obtener ganancias para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Rosario, who lives in the town of La Union, works as a small producer in the area where he lives.  He requests his 7th loan with the objective of establishing some large areas to plant tuberous roots. If there is enough, he would also like to purchase improved seed, to secure the feeding of his livestock count in the summer, along with the production of milk and meat.  Later on he would like to obtain income to sustain his family.

loans.use: to sow yuca root.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 35 anos, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia. Cliente vive en la zona Urbana cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Ramon titular es comercio de animales, desde hace cinco años, contando con la experiencia necesaria para el manejo del negocio. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la labores derivadas de la pesca artesanal.
 
El destino del crédito será para invertir  en la culminación de acabados de su domicilio, como son tarrajeo de paredes y fachado, con el anterior crédito otorgado cliente culmino el techado total de sus paredes.
texts.en:
Ramon is 35 years old, he has two children and he lives in his own house. He lives in an urban area which has electricity and water supplies. It is a small community with approximately 200 families. 

Ramon has been working in animal trade for the past five years, relying on the experience necessary for the running of this business. He also generates additional income from his work as a small-scale fisherman.

The loan will be invested in the completion of finishing touches in his home, such as cementing the walls and the façade. His previous loan was used for roofing.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in the completion of finishing touches in his home, such as cementing the walls and the façade.

loans.name: Guarani - Ka’Aguy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guarani - ka’aguy esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son jefas de familia que tienen a su cargo mantener la casa y la familia.
Francisca es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás, gracias a este trabajo ha logrado ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por ninguna necesidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas y edredones, que son sus principales productos, a la vez agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Guarani-Ka’Aguy Group is comprised of 11 hardworking and entrepreneurial women that hope to be able to get ahead and help their families by means of working together.  They are the heads of their households and have to care for their homes and their families.

Francisca is one of the members of the group and she tells us that every day she begins work very early in the morning and works all day.  She sells all types of products door-to-door, such as bed sheets, blankets, quilts and more.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help her family and provide what they need so that they are not lacking for any basic necessities.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy bed sheets and quilts, her most important products.  At the same time she is thankful for this opportunity for herself and her friends.

loans.use: to buy quilts and bed sheets.

loans.name: 4 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta en el 4º ciclo del programa, esta integrado por 10 señoras, todas son vecinas, conocida de la zona.  Las integrantes de este grupo "4 de Octubre", son muy  unidas y  mantienen excelente conducta de pago. Esperan seguir el grupo llegar al nivel maximo  del programa "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras".
Edita es la presidenta de este trabajador grupo, y cuenta que por medio de la venta de queso y cría de pollos ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Edita día a día muestra que con trabajo y dedicacion se puede salir adelante, enseña a sus amigas mediante su ejemplo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de queso, con lo que podrá tener su producto en cantidad para poder seguir trabajando y a la vez seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is in the 4th loan cycle of the program. It is made up of 10 ladies, who are all neighbors and well-known throughout the area. The members of this group, “4 de Octubre” [4th of October] are very close and they have an excellent payment record. They hope the group will continue progressing to the maximum level of the program “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Committee of Enterprising Women].

Edita is the president of this hardworking group and she says that through her cheese sales and chicken breeding she has managed to get ahead and help her family. Everyday Edita shows that with hard work and dedication it is possible to get ahead. She leads her friends by example.

She is requesting the loan to purchase cheese, which she will have in a quantity that will allow her to continue working and at the same time help her family.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell on.

loans.name: Mujeres Actuales Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Actuales, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas las invito a formar un grupo.  El comité se encuentra  en el primer ciclo, están ayudándose las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
 Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Gabriela, quien se dedica a la peluquería. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y que luego gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo lo fue levantando poco a poco. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, tijeras, peines, shampoo, enjuagues y demás productos para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen trabajo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Actuales" committee was formed through the initiative of one of its members who wanted to help her friends and so invited them to set up a group.  The committee are in their first loan cycle and are helping each other so that they can all get ahead in life.

One of the women who belongs to this committee is Gabriela.  Gabriela is in the hairdressing business.  She says that she started out with a small business but, thanks to her efforts and work, she is gradually boosting it.  She is a very hard-working person who has a great desire to do well and continue growing her business.

Gabriela is requesting this loan to buy dyes, nail polish, scissors, combs, shampoo, conditioner and other products she needs in order to continue working and providing her customers with a good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish, scissors, combs, shampoo, conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Imelda is married and has two children. 

To make a living, she manage a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She has been in her business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Imelda joined GDMPC. Imelda is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 60 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Isabel has a business selling a variety of dried fish. She earns about 8,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Isabel has a requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Isabel would like to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old and widowed.  She has five children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Rosie sells meat. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Rosie  has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more meat for her meat shop.

Rosie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosie would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for her meat shop.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 48 years old, married and has three children, age 18, 20 and 24.

She sells scrap metals and shoe soles for recycling. She has been in the business for three years.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Through this, she has managed to employ two people in her business.

She hopes to own a piece of land in future and open another outlet of her business. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy scrap metals for resale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Susana has a grocery store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for two years. 

Susana is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase additional groceries to sell.  Susana has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She owns a retail shop where she sells animal feeds and fertilizer, which she has been doing for for 10 years.  She also farms to earn additional income.

Salome is requesting a loan for 55,000 KES, which she will use to buy animal feed and fertilizer. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to expand her business in five years.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jamilla's Group

texts.en:
Jamilla's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Jamilla is 22 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort portal region of Uganda.  For the past year, Jamilla has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Jamilla is  requesting a loan for 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell and will help Jamilla to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jamilla hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Jamilla is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jamilla's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando El Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Buscando el Porvenir” lleva ese nombre, ya que las integrantes están en busca de un porvenir mejor para sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Rafaela es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que siempre trabaja muy duro. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado de toda clase, y cuenta que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Rafaela solicita el préstamo para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, quiere poder comprar más pescados para poder congelarlos y tenerlos para cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Buscando el Porvenir' (Women Seeking the Future) committee chose their name because all of the group's members are in search of a better future for their families.  They are very hard-working, entrepreneurial women who would like to do well and help their families.

Rafaela is a very hard-working person who would like to do well in life.  For this reason, she always works very hard.  Her business is selling all kinds of fish and she says that she has a good number of customers who always buy her products.

Rafaela is requesting this loan so that she can continue investing in her business.  She would like to buy more fish so that she can freeze them and have them available for filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Arasape Poty Group

texts.es:
Las 10 miembros del grupo Arasape Poty son de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante por medio del trabajo que ellas mismas hacen. Desean poder darles a sus familias todo lo que ellas no tuvieron y que no pasen por ninguna necesidad.
Elva es una mujer muy creativa y detallista, y lo muestra con cada trabajo que hace. Ella se dedica al tejido en crochet, haciendo todo tipo de cosas, como sobrecamas, fundas, prendas, manteles  y demás. Cuenta que siempre vende todo lo que hace, ya que su trabajo es muy lindo y de buena calidad.
Elva solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos agujas, colorantes y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus tejidos.
texts.en:
The ten [female] members of the Arasape Poty group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are hard-working women who would like to make progress in life through the work that they do.  They would like to be able to give their families everything that they themselves did not have and ensure they do not suffer hardships.

Elva is a very creative and meticulous woman.  She displays these qualities in each piece of work that she makes.  Her business is crochet.  She makes all kinds of items such as bedspreads, cushion covers, clothing, tablecloths, etc.  She says that she always sells everything that she makes because her work is very beautiful and good quality.

Elva is requesting a loan to buy yarn, needles, dyes and other supplies she needs to continue doing her crochet work.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Agatha

texts.en:
Ma. Agatha is married and works hard to support her family. 

Ma. Agatha has an Internet café business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Ma. Agatha requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional computers and computer supplies and to pay for her employee's salary.

In the future, Ma. Agatha would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computers and computer supplies and to pay for her employee's salary.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas están hace varios años juntas, y siempre se ayudan en lo que pueden. El comité tiene mucha  experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  es mucho el tiempo que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo.
Una de las integrantes, Luci, está acompañada con Héctor, tienen 3 hijos. Luci se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, pero nos cuenta que su deseo es poder tener más variedad de comida para vender y así poder ayudarle a su marido a generar mejor ingresos para su hogar, ya que el dinero que gana no les alcanza para poder empezar con los trabajos que ella desea realizar es por eso que se integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda empezar con el trabajo que desea realizar. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, verduras, panificados y demás insumos, para que por medio de eso siga trabajando y esté más cerca de cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 15 members from the city of Encarnación.  They have been together for a number of years and they always help each other when they can.  This group has a lot of experience in teamwork as they work together often.  They get together every week to share, communicate, and internalize the innovations that are generated within the group.

One of the members is Luci.  She is married to Héctor and they have three children.  Luci sells all types of food, but she tells us that her dream is to have a bigger variety of food to sell so that she can help her husband earn more income for their household.  The money that she earns is not enough to be able to grow her business.  This is why she joined the group in her neighborhood so that she can receive the help that Fundación Paraguaya provides and she can begin working toward a bigger business.

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of meat, vegetables, greens, baked good, and other supplies so that she can continue working and she can get closer to making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Vya Renda”, el que se encuentra en el 1 Ciclo con 11 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas. Y se ayudan para poder mejorar sus estilos de vida.
Adalbina trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella nos cuenta que tiene las esperanzas puestas en que el programa de la fundación paraguaya les ayudará mucho, no solo a ella, sino también a sus amigas.
Adalbina solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el tiempo de frío y en esta época tiene muchas ventas. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad de crecimiento que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Vya Renda” and it is in its 1st cycle. There are 11 members, who with their respective activities, are very close, responsible and supportive of each other. They help one another to improve their way of life.

Every day from very early in the morning, Adalbina works selling all kinds of clothes. She tells us that she hopes that the Paraguayan foundation’s program will help them greatly, not just her, but also her friends.

Adalbina is requesting the loan to purchase winter clothes as the cold weather is on its way and she has many sales at this time. She is grateful to the Paraguayan foundation and to Kiva for the development opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell on.

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es:
Eufemia, sigue con su pequeño negocio de librería, desde su juventud, ha trabajado, apoyando  a su familia, sus hijos casados, su esposo trabando de albañil, ahorrando la mano de obra al hacer las construcciones.
Con este nuevo préstamo, seguirá con el levantamiento de paredes del cuarto, ya que no ajusto con los materiales, estando de altos costo , en donde terminara de comprar, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y poder seguir esta mejora, para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Eufemia continues to manage her small bookstore. From a young age, she has always worked to support her family. Her children are married and her husband works as a bricklayer, so this helps to save on the labor costs of their construction projects.

With this loan, Eufemia will continue putting up walls for a room. She does not have enough money in her budget for materials because of the high cost. In order to finish this project, she needs to buy blocks, sand, cement, and iron so that she can continue these improvements for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en su 5to ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Valeriana es la presidenta del grupo, y nos cuenta que siempre pone su mayor empeño en ayudar a sus amigas del grupo a que sigan motivadas y a que de esa forma puedan seguir saliendo adelante. Ella trabaja en la venta de comestibles, y cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a mantener su hogar y darle a su familia lo que necesitan.
Valeriana pide el préstamo para la compra de los insumos que necesita para seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The committee pictured is in its fifth business cycle, and the group has learned over its operating years the meaning of responsibility and of looking after the needs and hopes of the involved members. 

Valeriana is the president of the group, and she always gives her best effort to help her fellow group members stay motivated and get ahead. She makes a living selling food products, and thanks to this job she is able to bring in some income to help with household expenses and provide for her family.

Valeriana is requesting this loan in order to purchase necessary input items such as meat, condiments, vegetables and other items for making her food dishes.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité Pyapy Mbareté es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, y más adelante conformar entre ellas mismas una Coopetariva.
La Sra. Anatolia, presidenta del grupo tiene 55 años, ella es una persona con mucho entusiasmo y emprendedora, gracias a ella el grupo trabaja unido y siempre está motivado, es una muy buena líder. Ella se dedica al bordado de todo tipo de cosas, y cuenta que ya tiene una buena clientela, ya que sus trabajos son muy buenos.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar hilos de todo tipo, agujas y demás insumos para poder seguir bordando y de esa forma tener los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Pyapy Mbareté Group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  Their main objective is to grow each individual woman's skills and eventually to form between them a Cooperative.

Anatolia is the president of the group and she is 55 years old.  She is a very enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman and thanks to her the group works well together and is always motivated, as she is a great leader.  She sells all types of embroidered items and says that she has wonderful customers who do very good work.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy different types of yarn, needles, and other supplies so that she can continue embroidering and thus have the means to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy yarn, needles, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has three children.

To earn a living, Maribel has a business selling a variety of dried fish. She earns about 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak, an expert seamstress, is busy with her daily work in order to offer quick and good service to her customers. She operates this business from her house in a suburb of Phnom Penh, earning about $6 per day, as estimated by our credit officer. She has a few apprentices who are helping her. Pak is now 33 years old and married to a humble man. This couple doesn’t have any children, but they wish to have one soon. Pak lives with her husband, an old mother, and a niece.

With the loan she has requested from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, she would like to purchase an extra plot of farmland, on which she can hire laborers to grow rice for her daily sustenance. This will help her improve her living conditions somewhat. In the future, she aims to expand her present business.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es casado y tiene cinco hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa  se encuentra ubicada en la zona miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Carlos tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar solamente hasta la secundaria y actualmente obtiene ingresos ya que presta  servicios de amplificación para diferentes acontecimientos más que todo los fines de semana trabajando más de doce horas y hasta altas horas de la noche; es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar un amplificador más para continuar con su negocio, ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, estudios y gastos médicos de su familia que no cuenta con seguro medico.
El sueño de Carlos, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia, Más que todo a sus hijos ya que son cinco y necesitan su propio espacio, de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has five children. They live in a rented house where they only occupy two rooms that consist of adobe walls and a dirt floor. Their home is in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Carlos had the opportunity to study only through high school. He currently makes his living by providing sound services at different events, most of which take place on the weekends. This requires him to work more than 12 hours and late into the night. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy another amplifier so that he can continue his business. This is the only source of income that he has to cover food, education, and medical costs for his family since they have no insurance.

Carlos dreams of owning a house so that his family can be more comfortable. Most of all, his five children need their own space, so he hopes to improve their quality of life. This is the first time Carlos has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy another amplifier.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Soledad continua dedicandose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales como pollos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manerea que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animalitos como maiz. 


La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member who continue to farm and raise animals, such as chickens. She raises these animals so that she can sell them later to her customers who request them. Soledad has been in this business for many years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a responsible person who wants to help her family move forward. Soledad is requesting a loan so that she can buy feed for her animals, such as corn.

She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Patricia es de la ciudad de Santaní 51 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos todos ya mayores e independiente, que también la ayudan. Patricia se dedica a la producción y venta de leche.
Cuenta que tiene ya una buena clientela, ya que además tiene una pequeña despensa donde ofrece sus lácteos. Es una señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente con fundación paraguaya y muy cumplidora con sus obligaciones.
Ella solicita la ayuda, para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, productos a granel y demás, para poder surtir su despensa, ya que no quiere quedarse sin stock de esos productos. Patricia agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
51-year old Sra. Patricia is from the town of Santaní. She is married and has four adult children who live away from home but still help her. Patricia earns her living selling milk and says that she has good customers. She also has a small store where she sells milk products.

Patricia is a hardworking person who has been an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya, always paying her dues promptly. She is now seeking help to buy drinks, food items, canned goods, bulk items etc. as stock for her store. She doesn’t want to remain without these products in stock. Patricia is grateful for this opportunity for a loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food items, canned goods, bulk items etc

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is from Akhmeta District, East Georgia. She is 48 years old, unmarried, and lives with her mother and two nieces (12 and 14 years old). The children go to school. Her sister lives and works abroad to assist the family financially, and Maguli takes care of her pensioner mother and nieces. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for buying a business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a milk cow. Maguli produces yogurt and sells it in the village. Also the family gets a small amount of financial assistance from Maguli’s sister. The total average monthly income of the family doesn’t exceed 400 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, Maguli’s family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Maguli requested a loan from Credo to start a small business. Her loan request was approved via the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program includes business start-up and re-startup loans with conditions appropriate for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Maguli already has constructed a building for the grocery store in front of the family home. With the loan, she will purchase inventories for the store and meet her first customers. Maguli will work as a salesperson herself. She will sell a variety of grocery products, including dairy products from their cow. She is sure that the store will function profitably, as there are no similar stores nearby. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 36 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Silvio y sus 3 hijos, en la localidad de Rundo. 
Ella realiza varias actividades; una de ellas es la compra y venta de animales, también cría vacas de las que extrae 15 litros de leche diariamente, la cual vende a una empresa de lácteos. Así también, desde niña y hasta ahora es agricultora, siembra maíz, papa, olluco y alverja en terrenos propios y otros alquilados. Sus productos, una vez cosechados, los vende en la capital; para ello cuenta con una persona que viaja a hacer la venta, y una vez terminada regresa con sus ganancias

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Rundo al progreso” y este es el crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo. Y por lo que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Eugenia invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y semilla para la siembra de alverja y maíz.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 36 years old. She lives with her husband Silvio and their three children in the town of Rundo.

Eugenia engages in various activities. One of them is buying and selling animals. She also raises dairy cows and is able to extract 15 liters of milk per day, which is sold to a dairy company. From the time she was a girl to the present day, Eugenia has worked as a farmer. She grows corn, potatoes, ulluco, and peas on her own land and in other fields that she leases. Once her products are harvested, they are sold in the capital. She hires someone to make the trip and handle the sales. Once the products are sold, that person returns with her profits.

Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank "Rundo al Progreso" and this will be her ninth loan with MFP. She appreciates the financial support that she has received this entire time. Eugenia promises to be punctual with her payments. She will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers and seeds for planting peas and corn.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 42 years old, married and has seven children. She operates a mobile money transfer (m-pesa) business, which enables electronic payment through mobile phones. (Customers pay cash for e-float, a type of electronic value.) She has been in the business for two years and has one employee. Besides that, she does farming to earn extra income.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to add e-float to her mobile-phone-money-transfer business.

loans.use: To add e-float to her mobile-phone-money-transfer business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 39 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children. 
Ofelia has a grocery store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Ofelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: For the last eight months, Peter has earned a living by running a transport business. He has eight employees, and earns money on the side by renting out homes. Before he went into these lines of work, he was a poultry farmer. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to meet his family's needs because he has been trained on financial management. In the future, he hopes to own a fleet of buses and a large transport company. He has requested a loan for 50,000 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosita se desempeña como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y muy querida por sus  compañeros de trabajo, alumnos y padres de familia.   Solicita su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda, como es hecharle embaldosado a la cocina, su sueño es gozar de mejores condiones y gozar de salud y un trabajo digno y con un mejor salario.
texts.en: Rosita has been a primary school teacher for 10 years, and she is a very responsible person, really popular with her colleagues and with her pupils and their parents. She is requesting her 2nd loan to invest it in the improvement of her house by tiling the floor of her kitchen. She dreams of having better living conditions, to remain healthy and to have a good job with a better salary.

loans.use: to tile the floor of her kitchen.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 61 años de edad, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, y ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desde muy joven ha trabajado y que no teme a ningún desafío.
Maria cuenta que tiene una Bodega desde el año 2008, donde le va muy bien, ya que tiene un negocio bien surtido, y eso le da mucha clientela. Cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y también ha podido mejorar mucho su casa.
La Sra. Maria solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, energizantes y demás, con lo que podrá tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
61-year old Sra. Maria is from the town of San Lorenzo. She characterizes herself as a hardworking and enterprising person who has worked since she was very young and is up to any challenge. 

She has run a store since 2008 and all is going well. The store is well-stocked and brings in many customers. Because of her store, Maria is able to help her family and has improved her house a lot. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy drinks such as pop, wine, beer, energy drinks etc. so that she has a wide variety of stock in the store.

loans.use: buy drinks such as pop, wine, beer, energy drinks etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, está felizmente casada, y de ese matrimonio tuvo hijos. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa y comenta que hace dos años que se dedica a esto y le está yendo muy bien, pues ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio.
Solicita el crédito, ya que quiere surtir su negocio con los productos esenciales, como ser leche, panificados, azúcar, yerba, carne y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Celia lives in the city of Encarnación.  She is happily married and has children from her marriage.  She has a small grocery store in her home which she says she has been working in for two years.  She says that it is doing very well because she has good customers who always come to her business.

Celia is requesting this loan as she would like to stock her business with essential products such as milk, baked goods, sugar, yerba, meat, etc.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving as it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy milk, baked goods, sugar, yerba, meat, etc.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Leonita has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 14 years and earns additional income from food vending. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Analina

texts.en: Analina is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. Analina has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF. She has run her general store for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling charcoal. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.es:
Fortunita tiene 40 años, vive en compañía de uno de sus cuatro hijos, Edgar. 
Ella se dedica a la siembra de papa, olluco, alverja y otros productos de acuerdo a la temporada. Sus cosechas las vende en la ciudad porque allí obtiene mejores ganancias. Actualmente tiene sembrado olluco y espera, dentro de muy poco, cosechará. Ella sabe que para obtener una buena producción de estar muy al pendiente de sus cultivos, limpiándolos y fertilizándolos constantemente.

Pertenece al banco comunal “Rundo al progreso” y este es el crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, y además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, pues las personas son responsables y solidarias.
Fortunita invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Fortunita is 40 years old and lives with one of her four children, Edgar.

She grows potatoes, ulluco, peas, and other products according to the season. Her harvested crops are sold in the city because she is able to generate more revenue there. At the moment, she is planting ulluco and hopes to harvest after a very short period. Fortunita knows that in order to obtain good production, she must remain very diligent with her crops, weeding and fertilizing them constantly.

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Rundo al Progreso" and this will be her ninth loan with MFP. Fortunita is grateful for the financial support she has received throughout this entire time. She promises to be punctual with her payments and is glad to be part of her group because the people are responsible and supportive. Fortunita will invest the money she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers and pea seeds for the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Regina works hard to support her family. She runs a wholesale egg-selling business and supplements her income by selling rice. She has requested a loan for PHP 17,500 from NWTF to buy more of the supplies she needs to sell eggs. Regina has sustained her business with 25 previous loans from NWTF, all of which she has repaid. She hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for an egg-selling business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn works hard to support one child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Jovelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Didencia

texts.en: Didencia works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in her current line of work for 11 years and hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell in her retail business. Edna has been in this business for 10 years. Edna earns more income from a sari sari (general) store. Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 30 years old and single. He operates a mobile business where he sells tissue paper, soap, and toothpaste. He has been in the business for eight years. Previously, he was employed elsewhere. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned to save regularly because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of owning a permanent business location in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of soap and tissue paper.

loans.use: To add to his stock of soap and tissue paper

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en: Baasan, 26, lives with her parents, sister, and younger brother in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her parents are retired. Her sister is an English teacher at Golden Bridge school, and her brother is a bus driver. She is a hairdresser. She started her business in 2007. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. She would like to buy a hybrid car for her family's use. The price of the car is 7,900,000 MNT. She has prepaid 3,000,000 MNT for the car. Now she is requesting 4,900,000 MNT to pay off the rest. She is very talented and diligent. She says, "I would like to use the hybrid car for my business and my family. Time is very important for my business. I can save more time with the hybrid car."

loans.use: To buy a hybrid car

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 41 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela. She is married and has four children. Marife has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for five years. Marife requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Marife has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marife hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema is 46 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin. She is married and has eight children. Ema has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for four years. Ema requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Ema has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ema hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: Helmer Damian

texts.es:
Helmer  tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una comunidad Rural  de Jesús de Otoro del Municipio de Taulabe, Departamento de Comayagua.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, específicamente la producción de café para la venta. Lleva 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad la cual es su fuente de ingresos ya actualmente la cosecha de café le esta dejando buenas ganancias. Trabaja todos los días y todo el día en su cultivo.
El préstamo que ha solicitado es para comprar fertilizante para darle el mantenimiento necesario a la  finca de café, para sacar buen producto y obtener mejores ganancias.
La meta que el tiene es seguir trabajando  para que sus cultivos aumenten y seguir generando los ingresos que le ayuden a mantener su familia.
texts.en:
Helmer, age 24, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  They live in Jesús de Otoro, a rural community in the Taulabe municipality in the Comayagua department.

His business activity is agriculture.  Specifically, he produces coffee to sell, and he has been doing this for five years.  This business activity is his source of income, and the coffee harvest is now giving him good income.  He works all day, every day on his crops.

The loan that he has requested is to buy fertilizer to give his coffee farm the maintenance it needs.  He will do this in order to get a good product and obtain better income.

The goal that he has is to continue working in order to increase his crops and to continue generating income that helps him support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to give his coffee farm the maintenance it needs.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.es:
El señor Expedito tiene 67 años de edad, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo y vive en su propia casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Expedito se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, tiene una ferretería en su casa que es atendida por el mismo o por su esposa que siempre lo ayuda. tiene mucha clientela en la zona ya que es prácticamente la única ferretería en el Barrio y es muy concurrida por las personas que habitan allí. La esposa también tiene una actividad independiente, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier imprevisto.
Expedito solicita el crédito para poder surtir su ferretería con todo tipo de insumos, como ser herramientas, clavos, pinturas, y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Expedito, 67, has been married for a long time, and lives in his own home in the city of Encarnacion. 

Expedito has had a business for a number of years.  He has a hardware shop in his home that he runs with his wife, who always helps him.  He has a lot of customers in the area, because his is practically the only hardware store in the neighborhood, and so it is very popular with the local residents.  His wife also has an independent activity; she has a business selling perfumes and cosmetics.  Thanks to these businesses, they have been able to get ahead, educate their children, maintain their home and cover any unexpected bills.

Expedito is requesting a loan so that he can stock his hardware store will all types of products, including tools, nails, paints and other items.  He is grateful for the help that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy tools, nails, paints and other hardware items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 59-year-old married woman with 3 children; two of her children are in school. Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her food stall.  Lolita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Babycel

texts.en:
Babycel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is requesting a loan for PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. Babycel has been in this business for 6 years. Babycel earns additional income from a ready to wear business.

Babycel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of previous loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Blanca Patricia

texts.es:
Puerto Quito es una ciudad y parroquia urbana en la provincia de Pichincha, en Ecuador. La ciudad se encuentra en un proceso de crecimiento debido al del ecoturismo en la zona, la principal atracción es la “La Cascada Azul”. Se encuentra a 140 km de Quito, la capital. 
A pesar de pertenecer geográficamente a la sierra ecuatoriana, el clima de Puerto Quito y su geografía es más similar a la costanera. Al estar ubicada en el bosque tropical ecuatoriano, registra las más altas temperaturas de la provincia, alrededor de 25°C; ya que la temperatura y las condiciones atmosféricas se prestan para que la agricultura se centre en productos tropicales Patricia decidió dedicarse al cultivo de cacao, la herencia que su padre le dejó. 
Desde hace 4 años Patricia junto con su esposo se dedican a la plantación, crecimiento y recolección del cacao. Esta emprendedora de 25 años lucha cada día por sacar a su familia adelante, ella vive con su pequeño hijo de 2 años y su esposo Ángel de 28 quien le ayuda diariamente en la plantación. 
Se dedican al cacao alrededor de 6 horas diarias, después de cada jornada Patricia se centra en el cuidado de su familia, disfruta el salir a pasear con ellos y compartir momentos inolvidables. Su plantación queda a casi 10 minutos de su casa, lo que facilita de cierta manera el transporte hacia su trabajo. 
Lo más difícil en cuanto al cuidado de la producción es lo que corresponde a la fumigación de las plantas. No sólo por el costo del producto que utilizan, sino por la movilidad dentro de la plantación y la mano de obra. Lo que Patricia espera es poder aumentar la producción de su propiedad comprando más semilla y fertilizantes y así tener más ingresos. Ella sueña con tener una mejor calidad de vida y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Puerto Quito is a city and urban parish in Pichincha Province, Ecuador. The city is in the process of growth resulting from ecotourism in the area. The main attraction is "La Cascada Azul" (The Blue Waterfall), which is located 140 kilometers from the capital of Quito.

Despite its geographical location in the Ecuadorian mountains, Puerto Quito experiences weather that is very similar to that along the coast. Since it is located in a tropical rain forest, the highest temperatures in the province reach approximately 25°C. The temperature and the atmospheric conditions provide a suitable environment for the cultivation of tropical products.

Patricia decided to grow cacao since it is a tradition that was passed on to her by her father. For the past four years, she and her husband have managed a plantation where they grow and harvest cacao. This 25-year-old entrepreneur strives each day to move her family forward. She lives with her two-year-old son and her husband Ángel, age 28, who helps each day with the work around their plantation. Patricia spends around six hours each day looking after her cacao plants. After her work day is finished, she focuses on taking care of her family. She enjoys spending time with them and sharing unforgettable moments. Her plantation is located almost 10 minutes from her house, so it is easy for her to get to work. The most difficult part of the production process is the fumigation of the plants. Not only is the cost of the supplies she uses expensive, but so are the costs of labor and providing transportation around the plantation.

Patricia hopes to increase the production on her property by purchasing more seeds and fertilizers in order to generate more income. She dreams of having a better quality of life and providing the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 29 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo y viven en una aldea que pertenece a Taulabe, Comayagua.. Wilfredo desde pequeño ha realizado la actividad de empacar cal, y hace 8 años se dedica a su propio negocio de elaboración de Cal.  Este producto es utilizado en la construcción y es usado para cocinar maíz. El compra los insumos como ser la piedra, esta la quema en un horno y produce la cal, luego la empaca en sacos o bolsas y la vende. Su negocio está ubicado en una zona donde transitan muchos vehículos a orilla de carretera, lo que le favorece para sus ventas. Ha solicitado varios préstamos con ODEF para este negocio, actualmente solicita el sexto préstamo para la compra de materiales como la piedra, leña, bolsas y para el pago de trabajadores quienes empacan el producto. Su sueño es mantener y ampliar el negocio para que genere buenas ganancias y lograr un bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old, married, and has a son.  They live in a village in Taulable, Comayagua.  Ever since he was little Wilfredo has been packaging lime powder.  For eight years he has had his own business of making lime powder.

This product is used in construction, and it is used for cooking corn.  He buys the supplies like the limestone, he burns it in an oven, and he produces the lime powder.  Then he packs it in sacks or bags and sells it.

His business is located on the roadside in an area where a lot of vehicles travel.  This is favorable for his sales.

He has requested various loans from ODEF for this business.  He is currently requesting his sixth loan to buy materials like limestone, wood, and bags, and to pay workers to pack the product.

His dream is to maintain and expand the business in order to generate good income and achieve a state of well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials like limestone, wood, and bags, and to pay workers to pack the product.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo es de la ciudad de Concepcion, tiene un hijo, vive en casa de su madre y con sus hermanas, para Gustavo no fue facil la vida por que desde que el tenie 14 años su mama les dejo para irse a España a buscar un mejor futuro paya él y su familia y desde entonces ya no esta mas con su madre, solo la ve cada 4 o 5 años, aunque su mama.
El señor Gustavo se dedica actualmente a la venta de todo tipo de electrodomésticos, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, pues tiene muy buenos precios y lo hace accesible a sus clientes, y eso le ayuda mucho. Comenta que está a punto de casarse con su novia y poder formar así una familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, que tanto le esta ayudando.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo is from the city of Concepción.  He has a son and he lives in his mother's house with his two sisters.  For Gustavo life was not easy because when he was 14 years old his mother left them in order to go to Spain to look for a better future for him and her family, and since that time he has not been with his mother.  He only sees her every four or five years, even though she's his mother.

Gustavo works currently selling all types of electrical appliances, and it is going very well for him.  He offers very good prices and it makes them accessible for his customers, and that helps him a lot.  He comments that he is on the point of getting married to his girlfriend in order to start their own family.  He is asking for credit in order to purchase electrical appliances for sale, and in that way to be able to continue growing his business, which is helping him so much.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow and has 3 children.  Her business is located in Eguafo near Cape Coast. She cooks banku to sell and has been in this business for 20 years. Aba serves banku with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce. She uses her income to support her family and pay for household expenses. 

Aba's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the profit from her business to build a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Kenia Yojana

texts.es:
Kenia tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos y su madre en una colonia suburbana de san Pedro Sula.
Kenia tiene 8 años de realizar su propia actividad de negocio, ella elabora chicharrones de cerdo y vende viseras de carne de cerdo que son utilizadas para hacer otras comidas.los chicharrones tienen gran demanda ya que son ricos, crujientes y se comen acompañados de yuca, tajadas o en sopa de frijoles. Esta solicitando ya el segundo préstamo a ODEF por 10,000.00 Lempiras, para surtir el negocio de carne de cerdo especial para la elaboración de los chicharrones. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y con las ganancias va ir haciendo reparaciones a su casa para vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 29, is a single mother with two children.  She lives with her children and her mother in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Kenia has had her own business for eight years.  She makes “chicharrones” [fried pork rinds], and she sells pork viscera, which are used to make other food.  There is a great demand for the chicharrones because they are delicious and crispy.  They are eaten with manioc, fried plantains, or in bean soup.

She is requesting the second loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras in order to stock her business with pork to make the chicharrones.  Her goal is to continue growing in the business.  She will use the income to make repairs on her house in order to live better with her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with pork to make chicharrones.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo u a sus dos hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura. Su comunidad tiene una calidad de vida bastante precaria y solo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, pavos y gallinas los cuales cría en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio, engorda lo suficiente para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de su localidad, Flor cuenta con mas de cinco años de experiencia en su negocio por lo que cuenta con mucho conocimiento sobre el cuidado de animales.

Se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, de este modo se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio lo cual le permitirá mejorar se calidad de vida.

Flor agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán con su primer crédito financiado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Flor is a 41-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and two children in one of the small villages that make up the rural part of Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in Piura region.  The quality of life in Flor's community is pretty precarious and the only basic service residents receive is electricity.

Flor's business is raising and selling sheep, turkeys and hens which she keeps in pens near her home.  She fattens them and then sells them in the town market.  Flor has more than five years experience in her business and so is very knowledgeable when it comes to caring for her animals.

Flor is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles which she plans to use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for fattening her animals so that they develop better and will fetch a better price.  This will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Flor gives thanks in advance to the people who will support her with her first loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “INTOCABLES” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes donde la señora Josefa es la tesorera.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, servicio de café, etc.
La señora Josefa cuenta que hace un año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una de sus compañeras; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural, mismo que trabaja hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.
