El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de medicamentos naturales) los que comprarán de las personas que elaboran y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que el el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Intocables" is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of six members and Sra. Josefa serves as the treasurer. The members have developed business activities that include selling food, selling clothes, serving coffee, and other ventures.

Sra. Josefa joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from one of her other group members. She currently has a business of selling natural medicines. Josefa learned this trade from her parents and has been working for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying natural medicines, which will be purchased from the people who make them and then sold from her established vending post. Working in this manner helps to move her family forward. Josefa is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Josefa said she enjoys the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, la zona en donde reside se encuentra ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

José desde hace aproximadamente once años se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la agricultura. Por un lado se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento  ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona. Por otro lado cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que cosecha lo comercializa también en el mercado local. Con estas actividades de agencia de ingresos económicos para solventar la economía de su familia.

El ya es cliente antiguo en Edpyme Alternativa y también ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva en el pasado, gracias a ello su nivel de vida ha mejorado bastante. Actualmente está solicitando un nuevo crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de limón y también en la compra de alimento para el engorde de sus animales. Con este crédito su negocio mejorará aun más. José agradece a las personas que le apoyaron a través de Kiva en su último préstamo y agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán ahora.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home.  His house does not receive basic services.  The area in which he lives is in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

José has been working in agriculture for approximately eleven years.  He raises and sells sheep.  His animal pen is large and is located a few minutes from his house.  He feeds his animals nutritionally-balanced feed and natural pasture so that they reach an ideal level of growth.  He then sells them in the different markets in the area.  In addition, José also has some farmland where he grows lemons and mangoes.  Once he has harvested his fruits, he sells them in the local market.  These income-generating businesses allow him to provide for his family.

José is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has received a loan through Kiva in the past.  Thanks to that loan, his standard of living improved quite a lot.  He is currently requesting a new loan for 2,500 soles which he plans to invest in buying fertilizers for his lemon crops and feed with which to fatten his animals.  This loan will allow him to improve his business even further.  José is grateful to the people who supported him with his last Kiva loan and he gives thanks in advance to those who will help him now.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crops and also feed for fattening his animals

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela de 64 años de edad está casada  hace 48 años con el señor Georginio de 72 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad y cada uno ya formó su propio hogar.
La señora Angela tiene este negocio desde hace 32 años , es una despensa y carnicería que es administrada por ella, su marido se dedica al engorde de ganado y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos familiares y que puedan vivir dignamente.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de harina, azúcar, fideos, arroz, golosinas, carnes, carbón y otros artículos que pondrá a disposición de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Angela is 64 years old and has been married for 48 years to Mr. Georginio, who is 72 years old.  They have three children, all grown, and all have already formed their own families.

Mrs. Angela has had this business for 32 years.  It is a grocery store and butcher shop that she manages.  Her husband is engaged in the fattening of cattle and together they help to maintain the family's expenses so that they can live in dignity.

Angela is requesting this loan to buy flour, sugar, noodles, rice, sweets, meat, coal and other items that she will make available to her customers. She gives thanks for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and the Paraguayan Foundation (Fundación paraguaya).

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, noodles, rice, sweets, meat, coal and other items

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
Lenny tiene 34 años, es una mujer amable, trabajadora y emprendedora. Está separada de su pareja y padre de su único hijo de 16 años. Vive en compañía de su madre, sus dos hermanos, su hijo y su cuñada, habitando la casa que les dejó su padre como herencia.

Su principal actividad es la venta de uno de los platillos típicos más representativo del Perú, que es el “cebiche”, este es un negocio familiar que tiene cerca de 10 años, ahí atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, con el apoyo de su madre, su cuñada, y sus hermanos. Desde que se inició en este trabajo ha obtenido grandes logros, ya que sus ventas siempre fueron favorables. Por otra parte, hace 5 años, también vende ropa y zapatos, sus clientes le hacen el pedido y ella selecciona los mejores modelos para que siempre estén complacidos. Le gusta mucho sus actividades, ya que la mantiene ocupada y le generan buenos ingresos económicos, necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hijo. Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo en la venta de ropa, planes consolidar su independencia laboral con el establecimiento de su propia tienda de ropa y calzado, mientras continua trabajando en su restaurante.

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir y zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños. Con otra parte del dinero también adquirirá algunos ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración del cebiche.
texts.en:
Lenny is 34 years old. She is a kind, hardworking, and enterprising woman. She is separated from her partner, the father of her only son, who is 16 years old. She lives with her mother, her two brothers, her son, and her sister-in-law, in the house they inherited from her father.

Her main business activity is selling one of the traditional dishes that best represent Peru, ceviche. This is a family business which has been running for almost ten years. She serves her customers very attentively, with support from her mother, her sister-in-law, and her brothers. She has made great achievements ever since she started working in this business, since she always had favorable sales. On the other hand, five years ago she started selling clothing and shoes also. Her customers put in orders and she selects the best items so that they are always satisfied. She enjoys her work very much, because she keeps busy and generates a good financial income, which she needs in order to cover her own personal expenses, as well as her son's. In light of the positive results she is getting by selling clothing, her plan is to consolidate her job independece by setting up her own clothing and shoes store, while she continues working at her restaurant.

This is her 12th loan with MFP, so she is grateful to everyone who makes it possible for her to keep working towards her goals. She is once again very committed to pay her installments timely, as she has done in the past. And she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, because all of its members are good, kind, and supportive. 

She will invest the amount requested (S/. 2000) in the purchase of clothing items and shoes for women, men, and children. She will also use part of the money to purchase some of the ingredients that she needs to prepare ceviche.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing ceviche and also clothing for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells rice and fish stew in Putubiuw near Cape Coast, Ghana.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  In front of Abena are bags of rice and oil which she uses to cook.  She is married and has five children.  She uses her income to help her husband feed their children.  Abena will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook.  With the profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Essowazina

texts.fr:
Essowazina est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une gérante de boutique. Il a 1 enfant âge de 3 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Essowazina travaille comme vendeur depuis 2000. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Essowazina a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Essowazina voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essowazina is 34 years old. He is married to a shop manager, and the couple have a 3-year-old child who does not yet go to school. 

Essowazina has been selling general food items since 2000. He works alone out of his shop, and sells to anyone. He buys his merchandise in Lomé. At present time, his main difficulty is a shortage of stock. 

Essowazina is seeking a third loan from WAGES to buy food products. He wants to reinvest in his activity. 

In the coming years, Essowazina he would like to expand his business. He plans to use the profits to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 54 years old and a loving mother of seven children: four single children and three married children. Two of her children are employed in various careers and add to her income and help the family. Son is a farmer, who spends most of her time working at the rice field to generate income for her family. She has tried to work harder, since her husband passed away and left all of their children for her to raise. However, Son has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She has been a farmer for more than 22 years. 

Due to the high costs of commodities, Son has requested a loan of USD 1,000 to buy consumer goods, especially kitchen supplies, to use in her household. In the future, she plans to send all of her children to school. Education is the best legacy she can pass on to them. She pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from HKL next time.

loans.use: To by consumer goods, especially kitchen supplies, to use in her household

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Kwesi has operated a grocery store at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. He sells milk, Milo, sugar, soups, soft drinks, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, and other items at his store. Kwesi is married with four children. He uses his income to pay his family's rent and utility bills. 

Kwesi is requesting a loan to purchase a wider variety of grocery items to satisfy his customers. He plans to expand his business with his new profit.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 65 years old and married with seven children. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines. Angelina has operated her business for the past ten years and she sells a variety of items such as rice, soft-drinks, snack foods, and other groceries. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Angelina is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a large quantity of merchandise to sell in her grocery store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a big tank that for water storage

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba cooks "banku" (a local dish made from corn dough) for sale and serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce. She is a widow and has four children. Aba has been in this business for six years now. She uses her income to support her husband with the general upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijo en casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, la comunidad en donde reside se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  En toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Mariela se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desde hace dos años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. La venta de esta bebida siempre es constante y abundante en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos sacan adelante a su familia.

Ella es una cliente antigua de Edpyme Alternativa y también de Kiva, con quienes ha mantenido un crédito en el pasado, en su momento el crédito fue de mucha ayuda por lo que ella se encuentra agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron. Debido a que se encuentra próxima la temporada de invierno en la zona en donde reside, Mariela ha decidido adquirir calaminas y adobes para continuar reforzando la estructura de su vivienda y seguir realizando arreglos, con la finalidad de contar mayor seguridad en su vivienda. Por ello ha solicitado un nuevo crédito de 3000 nuevos soles. Con sus ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y brindarle más comodidades y oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariela is 25 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in her own home which does not receive basic services.  The community in which she lives is located in Matanza district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Mariela's business is making and selling 'chicha de jora' (a delicious corn-based drink which is very popular in the north of Peru).  She has been in this business for two years as it is a custom that has been passed down from generation to generation.  Sales of this drink are always constant and plentiful in her area which has enabled her to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  Her husband is a farmer and together they provide for their family.

Mariela is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa and also Kiva.  She has received a loan from them in the past.  Her previous loan was very helpful and she is grateful to the people who supported her.  Owing to the fact that the winter season is approaching in her area, Mariela has decided to buy sheets of metal and adobe bricks so that she can continue strengthening the structure of her home and continue making repairs so that her home is more secure.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 3,000 soles.  She will use her profits to repay her loan and provide her family with more comfort and opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal and adobe bricks to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and lives in Basirang,Tudela. She is married with 4 children. 

Lorna has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 3 years. Lorna requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has six children. For the past five years, she has cooked and sold rice and fish stew at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. Sarah uses her income to help her husband feed their children.  

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and fish for her business. With her new profit, she plans to build a better stall to sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has seen great progress in doing business. The food stall he owns received a boost and the volume of business increased after additional restocking was done. Due to his ability to seize opportunities, the farm also produced enough supply for the family.

He was also able to pay for his children’s school fees from the additional income.

He looks forward to an having an even more profitable business season, due to the loan he is applying for. He believes this will go a long way in supporting his family and providing all the needs more comfortably. This loan of 52,300 Kenyan shillings (KES) will go towards the purchase of food stock and cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and flour.

loans.name: Duisenbai

texts.en: Duisenbai, 28, lives with his wife and his four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Two of his children are secondary school students and the other two children are kindergarten students. He runs a handicraft business. His wife helps with his business. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. He bought the land that he has been living on last year. He wants to build a garden on the land he owns. He is a hardworking and clever man. He said "I want to build a garden on my land. My family should live in beautiful, comfortable, and healthy environment." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy some trees and lawn and flower seeds to build a garden.

loans.use: To buy some trees and lawn and flower seeds to build a garden

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July tiene 40 años, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser alegre, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Julio, quien se dedica a la construcción civil. Su casa es propia, la adquirieron como fruto de su trabajo continuo, ahí viven con sus dos hijos de 17 y 7 años, quienes son su principal motivo para esforzarse día a día por brindarles lo mejor.

Su actividad es la venta de bebidas y helados de frutas tropicales, para eso cuenta con una congeladora en la que muestra las bebidas y una exhibidora para la venta de los helado. Ha establecido su negocio en un ambiente de su propia vivienda y lleva dedicándose a esto cerca de 10 años. Atiende ella sola, es muy amablemente y no tiene problemas con los créditos otorgados hasta la fecha, ya que inspira respeto y confianza, cualidades que le han permitido ganarse el cariño de sus clientes. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite estar en casa para atender a sus hijos menores, así como apoyar con la economía de su hogar. Viendo los buenos resultados y sus ganancias, tiene planes de ampliar y abrir una tienda de ventas de abarrotes y otros artículos de pasamanería, así como también zapatos, para venderlos en la temporada de verano que ya se acerca.

Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, pues conoció de esta institución hace más de 8 años atrás, y desde entonces los préstamos solicitados han sido vitales para su negocio. Por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. 

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas y helados, así como zapatos y sandalias que pondrá a la venta esta temporada.
texts.en:
July is 40 years old.  She is a woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She is cheerful, kind and very hard working.  Her partner, Julio, is a house builder.  The couple own their own home which they acquired through their continual work.  They live there together with their two children who are 17 and 7 years old.  The children are their main motivation to work hard every day.  They want to provide them with the best.

July's business is selling drinks and tropical fruit ice lollies.  She has a freezer where she displays her drinks and a display case for her iced treats.  Her business is located in her own home and she has been working in it for nearly 10 years.  She serves her customers on her own.  July is very kind and hasn't had any problems with the loans she has received up to now because she inspires respect and trust, qualities that have allowed her to earn the affections of her customers.  July enjoys her work because it allows her to be at home and look after her children and, at the same time, support her household financially.  Given the good results and profits that she has experienced, she has plans to expand and open a store where she will sell groceries, other miscellaneous goods, and also shoes in the summer.  

This is July's 16th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has been with this institution for more than eight years and the loans she has requested have been vital for her business.  For this reason, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time, as she has up to now.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy a larger quantity of drinks and iced treats.  She will also buy shoes and sandals that she will sell this season.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and iced treats to sell

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 30 años, es una mujer empeñosa, sociable y trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 14 años es Jhonny, de 39 años, quien es pescador. Vive en compañía de su pareja, junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 3 años, en la casa de su suegra.

Su negocio es la venta de pescado. Con la ayuda de su pareja acude a los ríos o lagos de mayor riqueza de su zona, para ello tienen un bote que les ayuda a trasladarse hasta el punto donde realizarán la jornada. Cuando han obtenido la cantidad necesaria de peces se dirigen al puerto pesquero del pueblo para ponerlos a la venta al por mayor, principalmente, ya sea a clientes ocasionales o algunos fijos que adquieren sus pescados para sus restaurantes. Cuando le resta algo lo ofrece en su puesto del mercado de la ciudad. Desde que se inició en este trabajo, hace 5 años, sus ingresos se han incrementado, sobre todo en las épocas de escasez de pescado, ya que en esa temporada puede incrementar sus precios. Este negocio le ha generado muchas satisfacciones, porque gracias a ello ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como comprarse enseres para su del hogar.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. A su vez, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará nuevas redes de pesca para poder trabajar con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Liliana is 30 years old, and is a hardworking and sociable woman.  Her partner of 14 years is Jhonny, he is 39 years old and is a fisher.  She lives in the company of her partner, along with their two sons of 10 and 3 years, in her mother-in-law's house.

Her business is fish sales.  With the help of her partner she goes to the richest rivers or lakes in her region. They have a boat that helps them to cross to the point where they spend the workday.  When they have obtained the necessary quantity of fish they go to the town's fishing port to sell them in bulk mainly, since there may also be occasional clients or some fixed clients that acquire their fish for their restaurants.  When something remains they offer it in their market stall in the city.  Since she started in this work 5 years ago, her income has increased, above all in the times of fish shortage, since in this season she can increase their prices.  This business has generated a lot of fulfillment, because thanks to it she has been able to pay off the expenses of her home, as well as buy furniture for the home.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is thankful for the opportunity and confidence that is put in her.  At the same time, she commits to honor the repayment of her quotas punctually, and furthermore is grateful to be part of the communal bank she pertains to, since the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the amount requested, 1500 nuevo soles, she will buy new fishing nets to be able to work with more convenience.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan is 25. She lives with her husband and her two children in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, an area of town with no running water and minimal roads. Her children are secondary school students. Since 2008, Bulgan has been working as a hairdresser. She is a diligent and smart woman. Bulgan’s husband helps with her business and she has many regular customers. In the wintertime, air quality is dangerously poor in Ulaanbaatar city because many households use coal to heat their houses. Coal usage is one of the biggest causes of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar.  

Bulgan is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to buy and install an electric heater and other materials in her house this summer to reduce her family’s coal usage and pollution.

loans.use: to buy an electric heater and insulation materials in her house to reduce pollution

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa sells charcoal at Putubriw, near Cape Coast. She has done this for 3 years now. She is married and has 2 children. She uses her income to assist her husband with feeding and paying their children’s school fees. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwow will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Qefsere

texts.en: Qefsere is from Kosovo. She is a widow and has three children. She has applied for this loan to buy a cow with a calf in order to provide milk and milk products for the family's needs and so as to sell the calf to generate income. With this cow, Qefsere will provide quality food for her children and there will be no need to buy milk or milk products at all. Qefsere will sell the remaining milk in the neighborhood and will try to save the money for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Méligan

texts.fr:
Meligan est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est marié å un assureur. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
Meligan travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle revend du poisson fumé pour tous clients dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Meligan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons fumés. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Meligan voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Meligan is 47 years old. She is married to an insurance agent, and the couple have three children aged 12 to 22 who all go to school. 

Meligan has been a reseller since 1999. Working alone, she sells smoked fish to all customers in the city. She buys her merchandise in Lomé. At present time, her main difficulty is a shortage of stock. 

Meligan is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy smoked fish. She wants to reinvest in her activity. 

In the coming years, Meligan would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells doughnuts, which she has done for 3 years. Agnes is married with one child. She uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Agnes will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnuts

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Sou is aged 58 and married. He has nine children, five of whom are dependent on him and a few of whom are still in school. Like other villagers, rice farming and cassava planting are the primary sources of the family’s income to make a living and he has been in this business for almost thirty-one years. Sometimes, he works for others for a fee to better support his family.

This is the second loan for Sou’s group of two members. Having been with VisionFund for one cycle, he is able to better support his daily living with his current earnings of around 18,000 KHR per day. Now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Sou, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his crops healthfully and increase crop yields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer tiene 24 años, es una joven mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 2 años es Anthony, de 29 años, con quien vive en la casa de sus suegros, en compañía de sus cuñados, ya que no tiene hijos por el momento. 

Su negocio es la venta de productos de perfumería y belleza femenina por catálogo. La modalidad de sus ventas es al crédito, dando un tiempo prudencial, a cada cliente, para que puedan cancelar su deuda totalmente.  Lleva en este trabajo cerca de un año y lo hace sola, es un negocio muy cómodo y confortable, ya que le permite manejar su tiempo con mucha tranquilidad. Sin embargo, tiene otro trabajo que requiere de mayor esfuerzo, que es la venta de granos, esto lo realiza hace 2 años, pero por cortas temporadas, dependiendo del clima, para ello cuenta con la ayuda de algunos familiares con quienes realiza la cosecha de los granos y luego los pones a la venta por sacos al por mayor. Ambas actividades le producen buenos ingresos económicos y se siente muy feliz por todo lo que obtiene como resultado de su esfuerzo. Para más adelante espera establecerse en local fijo para ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad y en mejores condiciones.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

El monto solicitado (S/. 700) lo invertirá en la compra de algunos productos de perfumería y así continuar incrementando su stock.
texts.en:
Jennifer, age 24, is an enterprising and hard-working young woman.  Anthony, age 29, has been her life partner for two years.  She lives with him and her in-laws in her mother and father-in-law’s house.  They do not have children at this time.

Her business is selling perfume products and women’s beauty products by catalog.  She sells on credit, giving each customer a reasonable amount of time so that they can pay in full.  She has been doing this work for close to a year, and she does it alone.  It is a convenient and comfortable business.  It allows her to manage her time in an easygoing way.

However, she does have another job, selling grains, which requires more effort.  She has been doing this for two years, but for short seasons, depending on the weather.  Some of her family members help her harvest the grains, which she later sells in sacks for wholesale prices.

Both business activities produce good income, and she is very happy for everything that she gets as a result of her effort.   Later on she hopes to establish a fixed place in order to sell more comfortably and in better conditions.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to those people who make it possible for her to continue with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments punctually as she has done previousely.

She is very happy to belong to her communal bank.  All of the members are very good, kind, and supportive of each other.

She will use the requested 700 soles to buy some perfume products and to continue increasing her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una zona agrícola que cuenta con servicios de agua potable  solamente, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales de los cuales cría específicamente pavos, patos y carneros, actualmente también ha adquirido una novilla, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, los corrales están situados en su domicilio. Julia aprendió esta actividad de sus padres por lo que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Los animales engordados son sacrificados para su venta los dias domingos y el resto es vendido en el mercado mayorista de Chiclayo los dias jueves de cada semana. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Su esposo es obrero agrícola y con lo que ambos ganan tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Julia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde, así como alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará y de la misma manera lo hará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a 48-year-old family woman who lives with her husband and their two minor children in a rural area within the district of Lambayeque. It is an agricultural area that only has drinking water services, and about 200 families live in this small community.

She works raising and selling animals, specifically turkeys, ducks, and rams. She has currently also purchased a young cow. She has been in this business for 15 years, and the farmyards are located at her home. Julia learned the business from her parents, which is why she knows the trade perfectly. The fattened animals are slaughtered and sold on Sundays, and the rest are sold at the wholesale market in Chiclayo on Thursdays every week. There is competition in this business, but she also has an extensive market for sales. Her husband is an agricultural worker and with what they both earn they try to move the family's finances forward.

Julia is requesting a 1500 nuevos soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She wishes to invest it in purchasing small fowl to fatten, as well as balanced feed. This investment will allow her business to improve, as well as her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small fowl to fatten, as well as balanced feed.

loans.name: Rigobert

texts.fr: Rigobert est un jeune camerounais âgé de 23 ans, fiancé et père d'un enfant âgé de 18 mois. il a également à sa charge un de ses neveux âgé de 13 ans. il vend des fruits (papayes,ananas, oranges)et des oeufs dans une banlieue de la place depuis deux ans.Il s'approvisionne dans les marchés avec une périodicité de 2 jours. Malgré sa jeune expérience dans le domaine, il bénéficie d'un portefeuille clientèle assez consistant dont il n'arrive plus à satisfaire la demande. il voudrait ainsi avec ce crédit renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à leurs sollicitations.
texts.en: Rigobert is a young Cameroonian, aged 23 years. He is engaged and the father of an 18-month-old. He is also responsible for the care of one of his nephews, who is 13 years old. He has been selling fruit (papayas, pineapples, and oranges) and eggs in a local suburb for the last two years. He restocks his stand every two days at the markets. Despite his youthful experience, he has such a large customer base that he can no longer meet demand. Therefore, he would like this loan to increase his stock of goods to better meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina is 36. She is married and has three school aged children. The scope of her engagement is agriculture and she sells milk and milk products at the local bazaar. Her family helps her to keep her business. She has 10 years experience in this sphere. Today she has applied for a loan of 600 AZN (manat) to start the repair of their house. The income from the business allows her to return the money in time.

loans.use: To make repairs to their house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a peddler. She sells vegetables like garden eggs (eggplant), peppers, tomatoes, onions, salted fish and other food items at Putubiw near Cape Coast. Efua has been in this business for some time now. She wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers, so a loan from Kiva will be used to buy a variety of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 49 years of age. She is married and has six children. Three of them work while the rest stay at home. 

Perveen is a housewife who remains at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

Her husband operates a scrap-selling business. He purchases scrap in bulk and supplies it to different factories and other scrap dealers in the city. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband's business. With the loan investment he will buy scrap in larger quantity to be able to fulfill his client's requirements and increase his income. 

Perveen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap selling business

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is 48 years old and is a married woman with a 10-year-old child. She earns a living selling home-cooked meals to her community. She earns about 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month with her business. She has requested a loan to purchase ingredients and cookware. Rosette hopes to expand her business and have her own restaurant in the future. She also hopes to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and cookware

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, and other food items at Putubiw near Cape Coast.  Ama has been in this business for some time now and wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers. Her loan from Kiva will be used to buy a variety of food items. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food items and an expanded variety of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: Ousseynou exerce depuis six ans un commerce de produits cosmétiques au marché central de sa localité.Il vend du parfum , des mèches ainsi que divers produits de beauté.Cette activité lui assure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter des mèches et du lait de beauté.Son ambition est d'agrandir sa cantine.
texts.en: Ousseynou has been selling cosmetics in the central market in his town for six years.  He sells perfume, hair extensions and other beauty products.  This business makes him income which allows him to cover his family's needs.  In order to strengthen his working capital, he is requesting a loan for 400,000 francs so that he can buy hair extensions and body lotion.  His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and body lotion

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina cooks and sells Ga kenkey (a fermented corn dough dish), which she serves with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Putubiw near Cape Coast. Sabina has done this for two years. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, ingredients used in preparing her Ga kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare her Ga kenkey for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is divorced and has two children. For the past year, she has worked as a baker, selling bread at Putubiw near Cape Coast. Margaret uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees.  

Margaret is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake and sell bread. With the new profit from her expanded business, she will purchase a modern gas oven to make her work more productive.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake bread

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a single parent who lives with her three children in Putubiw near Cape Coast, cooks and sells Ga kenkey, which she serves with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees.

Grace will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparation of her Ga kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare her Ga kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children. For the past four years, she has worked cooking and selling porridge that she serves with groundnuts and milk. Elizabeth uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children as well as pay their school fees.  

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize and groundnuts to prepare her porridge. She will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is twenty years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years Ruth has been working hard to manage her small hotel where she also offers meals.

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. She will use her loan to buy more fresh food for her dishes. Greater profits will mean that Ruth can buy more plates and cups and stock up on more food for the hotel. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy goats to start a livestock concern.

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ruth's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: stock up on more food for her hotel.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 29-year-old single lady. She lives with her mother and two siblings and their families in a modest house. Munira supports her family by running a kiosk. Three years ago, she started a small business selling mobile phone recharges, but as time passed she has been able to expand into a variety store where she sells products to meet daily basic needs such as snacks, sugar, coffee, and mineral water, along with mobile phone recharges. Munira makes the largest profit from selling mobile phone recharges as she already has many customers. She usually orders a mobile phone recharge of 3,000,000 IDR that will sell out within a week. Munira is thinking of adding more capital into her business especially the mobile phone recharges. 

Munira is requesting a 5,000,000 IDR loan from TLM to buy more credit recharges along with items for her general store such as noodles, eggs, bar soap, and other products.

loans.use: to buy credit recharges and noodles, eggs, bar soap, shampoo, and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 22 años, es una mujer joven, alegre, dinámica y con muchos deseos de superación. Su pareja desde hace 3 años es Caín, de 27 años, tienen una pequeña hija de 3 años y juntos viven habitando su propia casa, la que lograron construir con muchos esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus padres.

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes y bebidas, para ello estableció su negocio en su vivienda, donde tiene instalado un refrigerador que compró con el apoyo de su pareja para conservar siempre frías las bebidas y los helados que pone a la venta. Del mismo modo, acondicionó una pequeña tienda donde ofrece todo tipo de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Todos los días atiende a su clientela, desde muy temprano y con mucha amabilidad. Trabaja en este negocio desde hace un año y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su cuñada. Le agrada lo que hace, pues le permiten tener una ocupación en casa y tener tiempo libre para poder atender a  su pequeña hija, así como el ingreso adicional que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. De esa manera, espera progresar  para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. A su vez, como le está yendo bien, tiene planes de continuar desarrollándolo e incrementar la variedad de sus productos. 

Este es su crédito número 3 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará mayor variedad de abarrotes y bebidas, de esa forma planea mantener a todos sus clientes contentos.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old.  She is a young, cheerful, dynamic woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  Her partner of three years is 27-year-old Caín.  The couple have a young daughter who is 3 years old.  The family lives together in their own home which they managed to build as a result of their hard work, with help from their parents.

María's business is selling groceries and drinks.  She set up her business in her home and there she has a refrigerator that she bought with the support of her partner.  She uses it to keep the drinks and iced treats that she sells cold.  She also equipped a small store where she offers all kinds of groceries and basic household products.  Every day she serves her customers from very early in the morning and with a great deal of kindness.  She has been working in this business for one year and sometimes receives support from her sister-in-law.  María enjoys what she does as it allows her to work from home and also have time free so that she can look after her young daughter.  In addition, it gives her extra income which allows her to support her partner with their household expenses.  She would like to continue making progress in this way so that she can provide her daughter with a better quality of life.  As things are going well, she has plans to continue developing her business and to increase the range of products she sells.

This is María's third loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because it makes her feel more certain of being able to make progress in her work.  Once again, María pledges to make her repayments on time as she has in the past.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive.

María will use the loan for 1,500 soles that she has requested to buy a wider variety of groceries and drinks.  In this way, she plans to keep all her customers happy.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé  de 41 ans. Il est marié  à une revendeuse et ont 04 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 15ans et le dernier 03ans.
Kossi travaille comme blanchisseur depuis 1997. Cette activité est exercée dans une boutique et il est aidé par 07 personnes.
Kossi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la machine à laver, des fers à repasser et des détergents. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait créer des points de service  et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossi is 41 years old. He is married to a reseller, and the couple have four children aged 3 to 15 who all go to school. 

Kossi has been a laundry worker since 1997. He works out of his shop with seven helpers to assist him. 

Kossi is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy a washer, irons, and laundry detergents. 

In the coming years, he would like to open other service locations and provide for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy a washer, irons, and laundry detergents.

loans.name: Thu's Group Loan

texts.en:
Born in 1976, Thu, a mother of two sons, is a member of Van Thuong cluster. Her husband is a builder with a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong{VND}. For many years Thu has been growing rice and raising pigs.

A member of SEDA since 2009, in her previous loan she borrowed 6.322.000 VND, since repaid, and is now requesting 5.014.000 VND to buy chairs, tables, and groceries to open a store.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Trang is 30 years old and has one child. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy more clothes to expand her shop.

Nhung is 26 years old and has one child. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy new clothes for her shop.

Thanh is 48 years old and has two children. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy groceries.

Chinh is 50 years old and wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and groceries to open a store.

loans.name: P.

texts.en:
Paulina is a 48-year-old widow. She lives with her daughters, ages 16 and 19, and her mother. Paulina is the breadwinner for her family so she has to work hard to meet the whole family’s needs. She works as cashier in a small restaurant and also runs a poultry business at home. Paulina has a small cage that contains 400 chicks. 

Paulina is requesting a 7,500,000 IDR loan from TLM to improve her poultry business and purchase four boxes of chicks, fodder, and vaccines. Each box contains 100 chicks. Paulina hopes that her loan will assist her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of chicks, fodder, and vaccines

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a un hijo en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en el Caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. Su comunidad no cuenta con servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de utensilios, herramientas y accesorios de cocina, tambien a la crianza de ganado ovino, aves de corral y además a la venta de ropa. Su esposo le ayuda en la crianza de aves de corral. Desarrolla esta actividades hace aproximadamente mas de 7 años y con ellas se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Maritza se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de ganado para su posterior engorde, así como en la compra de más utensilios de cocina y accesorios del hogar. Ella es muy conocida en la zona y tiene clientela ya establecida, los que otoragan buenas referencias suyas.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 44-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and son in her own home, in the small village of El Porvenir Hualtaco, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in Piura region.  Her community does not receive basic services.

Maritza's business is selling kitchen utensils, tools and accessories.  She also raises sheep and farmyard birds, and sells clothing.  Her husband helps her to raise the farmyard birds.  She has been in these businesses for more than seven years and they enable her to provide for her family financially.

Maritza is requesting a loan for 1,800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she plans to use to buy livestock to fatten.  She will also buy more cooking utensils and household goods.  She is very well known in her area and already has existing customers who provide good references for her.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and also more cooking utensils and household goods

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr Teodoro es casado, tiene 45 años, es comerciante hace mas de 20 años tiene un local de Electrónica, donde arregla y vende todo tipos de Artículos Electrónicos.
El mismo trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el 2008, y comenta que gracias a los préstamos que le recibió su negocio creció y prospero mucho. Así también comenta que su sueño es poder comprar y tener un local propio ya que ahora mismo solo esta alquilando. El Sr. agradece a la Fundación paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona ya que le han ayudado mucho.
Solicita el crédito nuevamente para la compra de equipos electrónicos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Teodoro is married and is 45 years old.  He is a businessman and for the past 20 years he has had an electronics store where he repairs and sells all types of electronic articles.  He has also worked with Fundación Paraguaya since 2008 and he comments that thanks to the loans that he has received, his business has grown and prospered greatly.  He also notes that his dream is to be able to buy and have his own store, since right now he is just renting.  Teodoro thanks the Fundación paraguaya for the trust that they have placed in him since they have helped him a lot.  He is asking for a new credit in order to purchase electronic equipment so that he will be able to continue working and supporting his family.

loans.use: To purchase electronic equipment.

loans.name: Barbe

texts.fr: Barbe est une femme de 53 ans célibataire, mère de deux enfants dont l'âge varie entre 20 et 35 ans. Elle est  commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans déjà où elle vend les légumes frais (dolè lavé et non lavé). son petit commerce l'aide beaucoup, mais elle est souvant en difficultés pendant les saisons de manque d'où son envie de diversifier son activité en vendant aussi la tomate et les arachides. cela l'aidera à se consencrer plus sur l'un de ces produits en fonction des saisons, augmentera son nombre de clients donc lui donnera un bon bénéfice qui lui permettra non seulement de toujours augmenter le stock de ses marchandises mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Barbe is a 53-year-old single mother of two children whose ages range from 20 to 35 years old. She has been a shopkeeper in a local market for ten years, where she sells fresh vegetables (washed and unwashed.)  Her small business is very helpful to her, but things are often difficult during lean seasons.  For that reason, she would like to diversify her business by also selling tomatoes and groundnuts. This will help her to focus more on one particular product depending on the season and increase her number of clients. This will increase her profits which will not only allow her to continue to increase the stock of her goods, but also provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to diversify her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya, 67, is a responsible mother of four married children. She lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. At her age she still finds ways to provide for her family's needs.

Ya makes and sells Khmer natural medicines made from many different kinds of tree roots. One of her daughters helps her. Ya distributes her medicines to shop owners to be sold in the marketplace. Her daughter also sells them from place to place to make additional money.

Ya now is asking for a 2,500,000 KHR loan from HKL to help her buy timber and wood planks to repair her house. Ya has been a responsible client with HKL for a long time. This will be her sixth loan used to raise her family’s living standards. She is very thankful for your constant support and generosity.

loans.use: buy timber and wood planks to repair her house.

loans.name: Patty

texts.es:
Patty tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy creativa, humilde y muy trabajadora. Convive hace 12 años con Erick, de 28 años, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo pequeño a quien ama con toda su alma y por quien realiza todos los esfuerzos necesarios para salir adelante. Los tres viven felices en su humilde casa que lograron obtener como resultado de su trabajo.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa, ella misma se encarga de viajar a otra ciudad para comprar las prendas, al por mayor, seleccionando una a una la de mejor calidad y de los diseños más actuales y de las mejores marcas. Toda su mercadería suele distribuirla de manera personal visitando casa por casa a sus amigos, vecinos y personas conocidas, el plazo para el pago por las prendas lo coordina con sus clientes. Lleva en este trabajo 9 años y desde que empezó ha logrado obtener algunas cosas materiales que siempre ha deseado. Del mismo modo, hace 3 años ha incursionado en el negocio de la decoración para fiestas infantiles, en esta actividad trabaja con ayuda de otra persona y juntas realizan los diseños más creativos que se exhiben en cada fiesta en la que solicitan sus servicios.
Le gusta mucho sus dos trabajos, ya que en ambos puede relacionarse con las personas y desarrollar su creatividad y buen gusto en las cosas que ofrece. Para el futuro espera concretar su sueño de tener su propia tienda de ropa.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir, principalmente para damas. Asimismo se abastecerá de algunos artículos que usa en su trabajo decorativo.
texts.en:
Patty, 32, is a creative, modest, hardworking woman. She has lived with Erick, 28, for 12 years, and they have a small son whom she loves with all her heart and for whom she exerts much effort to provide for his needs. The three live happily in their simple home, which they managed to buy through working.

She sells clothing and travels to another town to buy wholesale merchandise, selecting the most fashionable, high-quality items and best labels one at a time. She distributes the merchandise personally, visiting her friends', neighbors', and acquaintances' homes, and coordinates payments with her customers. She has been doing this for 9 years and has managed to obtain some of the material things she wanted. Three years ago, she began a  business, setting up decorations for childrens parties, which she does with the help of another person. Together they create the most interesting designs for each party for which their services are contracted. She loves both jobs because she can relate to people and develop her creativity and taste through the services she offers. She hopes to have her own clothing store in the future.

This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP, and she is very happy to know she has financial backing and that she can feel secure growing her business. At the same time, she promises to make her payments in a timely manner, as she had done in the past. She is happy to be a member of her communal bank, since the other members are responsible and caring. With the amount requested (S/. 700), she will buy a larger quantity of garments, especially for women, and will also stock some items for her decorating business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell and supplies for her decorating business.

loans.name: José Félix

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el caserío Wiracocha, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. Su comunidad solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla es la ganadería, cuenta con mas de 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, cría sus cerdos, pavos y ovinos, los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales y cuando terminan de desarrollarse los ofrece en venta en el mercado local, su conviviente lo apoya en las actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

José desea adquirir animales y ademas alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograrlo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa por primera vez un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

José desea esforzarse al máximo para poder salir adelante y ofrecerle lo mejor a su futura familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran un joven trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
José is a 24, and head of his household. He lives with his wife in their own house, located in the settlement of Wiracocha, a rural area of the Tambogrande farming district. His community only has basic electricity service.

The business he carries on is livestock-raising. He has more than five years of experience running his business. He raises his pigs, turkeys and sheep, and feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they complete their development, he puts them up for sale in the local market. His life partner supports him in the work he does, and the good family relationship helps keep his business growing.

José wishes to acquire animals and also balanced feed for fattening his animals. This investment will allow him to continue the growth of his business, and in this way improve his quality of life. To achieve this, he has applied for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles.

José wants to to do his very best to succeed and provide the best for his future family. The people who know him consider him a hard-working and responsible young man.

loans.use: To acquire animals and also balanced feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks, fodder, and building materials.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 33años de edad, es soltero y radica en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Túcume, una ciudad bastante conocida por su atractivo turístico.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes desde hace cinco años. El ofrece estos productos a sus clientes en una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, gracias a su buena atención y esfuerzo cuenta con clientela fija. Adicionalmente trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina.

Debido al incremento de la demanda por los productos que ofrece ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de abarrotes para ampliar su negocio. José Manuel desea agradecer de antemano a las personas que le apoyen a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 33 years old, single, and lives in one of the small villages that make up the rural area of Túcume district.  Túcume is quite well known for its tourist attraction.

José Manuel has been selling basic household products and groceries for five years.  He sells these products to his customers from a grocery store that is located in his home.  Thanks to his good service and hard work, he has regular customers.  In addition, he also provides a transport service, transporting cargo and passengers in a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached).

Owing to an increase in demand for the products that he sells, José Manuel has decided to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to invest in buying groceries in order to expand his business.  He would like to give thanks in advance to the people who will support him through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy groceries so that he can expand his business

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem operates a livestock business from her home. She purchases cattle at a young age, raises them and then sells them on profit. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household chores very well alongside her business.
Shameem's husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his customers. Shameem has five sons, four of whom work while her youngest son is studying in second grade.
Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. With the loan investment she will buy a buffalo for selling after raising it up. She will also sell its milk to customers in her community to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita tiene de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Actualmente está separada del hombre con quien compartió sus días por muchos años, tiene 9 hijos, todos mayores. Vive en su casa propia, la que obtuvo como resultado de su unión de pareja y la comparte solamente con una hija, ambas ponen el mayor esfuerzo para tener una vida confortable.

Su actividad es la pesca. Para ello, cuenta con un pequeño bote implementado con las herramientas y accesorios necesarios. Pesca en las zonas aledañas a la ciudad o en algunos ríos de los que ya tiene conocimiento de sus recursos, orienta su trabajo a la obtención de la especies de mayor consumo, de mejor tamaño y a aquellos que tienen mejor precio en el mercado, respetando siempre las temporada de veda de las que se encuentran en peligro de extinción o periodo reproductivo. Cuando tiene los pescados, ella misma, con el apoyo de algunos de sus hijos, los vende en el mercado principal de su localidad, su venta la realiza al por mayor, a vendedores ocasionales o ambulatorios. Lleva en este trabajo 40 años y reconoce que es una actividad muy rentable por todas las ganancias que le genera, además le gusta, ya que es su fuente de ingreso económico. Comenta que gracias a este oficio ha podido llevar una vida cómoda y tranquila. Por ello, tiene planes de incursionar en el negocio del transporte  fluvial de pasajeros, planeando construir un bote especial para esa actividad.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

El monto solicitado (S/. 2000) lo invertirá en realizar pequeños arreglos al bote que tiene actualmente y dará un pago inicial para obtener otro bote.
texts.en: Paquita is 56 years old. She is a very hardworking woman with a big desire to better herself. She is currently separated from the man with whom she shared her days for a lot of years, she has 9 children, who are all grown up. She lives in a house of her own, which she got as a result of her relationship and shares it with just one of her daughters. They both put a lot of effort into trying to have a comfortable life. She fishes for a living. In order to do it, she has a small boat equipped with the necessary tools and accessories. She fishes in areas that are close to the city or in some rivers of which she already knows the resources that they carry. She directs her work towards obtaining the species that are consumed the most, those that are of the largest sizes and those that are better priced in the market, always respecting the close season of the species that are in danger of extinction or in reproductive period. When she has the fish, she sells it in her locality's central market herself, and with the help of some of her children. She sells at wholesale, to temporary or street vendors. She has been doing this for 40 years and acknowledges that it is a very profitable activity for the revenue that it generates. Also, she likes doing it, because it is her source of income. She says that thanks to this trade she has been able to lead a quiet and comfortable life. For this reason, she has plans to venture into the business of river transportation of passengers, and plans to build a special boat for this activity. This is her loan number 7 with MPF, which is why she is thankful for the people who make it possible for her to pursue her goals. On the other hand, she is very committed, once again, to make her repayments on time, as she did before. And she is very happy to be a part of her communal bank, since all the members are very kind, nice and supportive people. The amount requested (S/. 2000) will be invested into making small repairs to the boat she currently owns and will make a down payment to get the other boat.

loans.use: to fix her current boat and make a down payment to purchase a new one

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Gloria has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry food like maize. 

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Gloria to generate greater profits and improving her business more like adding more other foods for resale. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gloria's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: buy maize to resell

loans.name: Marthina

texts.en:
Marthina, 59, is married to Yance, 50. They are blessed with 4 children: Reni, 35; Serly, 34; Roy, 33; and Koni, 31.  The chilren are all married.  

Marthina runs a poultry business to generate additional income for her family. She has been engaged in this business since 2007. Currently, Marthina plans to expand the business as she has to meet the demand of her customers which is increasing from day to day. Therefore, she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000.  Marthina wants to spend the loan on chicks, fodder, shuck, and vaccine for the chicks. She is hoping that with the assistance from TLM, she will be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, fodder, shuck, and chicken vaccines

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng has owned and managed a rice farming business for many years. He is 34 years old and married. Recently, he has to live separately from his wife due to unavoidable family circumstances.  He now lives with his father, his elder brother and his children.  Despite his hardships, Chheng wants to work out his business and ensure a good education for his children. 

Chheng would like to request a loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 due to the financial difficulty he is experiencing nowadays. He will use the loan to buy farming supplies to improve the growth of his rice crops. Through using the loan, he hopes to obtain a plentiful harvest this coming crop season.

loans.use: buy rice farming supplies

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina sells cosmetics at Aboadzi near Takoradi, which she has done for some time now. She is unmarried.  Georgina uses her income to pay her utility bills and other necessary expenses.  She will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells bags of  maize and groundnut (peanuts) at Aboadzi near Takoradi, which she has done for 5 years now. Comfort is married to a driver and has 4 children.  She uses her income to support  her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and groundnut  to sell.   With the new profit, she wishes to expand her business so that she can become the primary groundnut vendor in her area.

loans.use: buy maize and groundnut to resell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia sells charcoal and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has done this for 3 years now. Leticia  is married  and has 3  children.  She uses her income  to support her husband to  feed their children as well as pay their school fees.  Leticia  will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal and ingredients for gari.  With her new profit, she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal and ingredients to make gari

loans.name: Yakobis

texts.en:
Yakobis is a 47-year-old man who is married to Mathelda, a 42-year-old lady. They have been blessed with five children: Elsa, 22; Prili, 21; Marthen, 17; Isabel, 9; and Isakh, 3. 

Yakobis owns a dump truck that is utilized to deliver building materials such as sand, bricks, and stone, to the customers.  Yakobis wants to initiate a business that sells these building materials and deliver them directly to the customers instead of just transporting them, but he has very limited capital to make it happen. Therefore, Yakobis is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.  He would like to use the money to buy sand and stone in bulk.

loans.use: buy sand and stone in bulk

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance operates a grocery shop at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has owned this store for many years now. In her store, she sells milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, and many other items. 
Constance is married with one child. She uses her income to help her husband to pay the utility bills and other household expenses. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With her new profits, Constance plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a small-scale trader. She trades in ladies’ and children’s dresses, underwear,  jeans, and shoes, and has been in this business for three years. She is a single parent and has one child. She lives at Aboadzi near Takoradi. Elizabeth uses her income to feed and clothe her child. 
Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more ladies’ and children's dresses and underwear for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth hopes to build a shop from which she can sell her goods.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies’ and children's dresses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys cooks rice and bean stew for sale at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She has been in this business for four years now. She is a single parent with three children, so she uses her income to pay her children’s school fees and meet other general expenses. Gladys will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for her stall. With her new profits, Gladys plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has operated a grocery store at Aboadzi near Takoradi for the past three years. She sells a variety of goods in her shop, such as milk, candies, tinned tomatoes, and soups. 
Rose is married with three children. She uses her income to help her husband in paying the household bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits, Rose plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells plantains and cassava at Aboadzi near Takoradi. Mercy has been selling food stuffs for three years now. She uses her income to help her husband with paying for their children’s school fees.  Mercy will use her loan to purchase a wider variety of food stuffs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells secondhand dresses, which she has been doing for three years. Comfort is married and her husband is a driver.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Comfort needs this loan to purchase more secondhand dresses to sell. With the new profit, Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand dresses to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es de la ciudad de Ybycui, tiene 22 años y está cursando el 4° año de la Carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería. Ella es la última hija de la familia y la única que aún vive con la madre, tiene dos hermanas y un hermano. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre agricultor.
Ella está estudiando con la ayuda de una hermana suya que trabaja en el hospital de Ybycui como enfermera, solicita el préstamo para el pago de la cuota y también para la compra de libros que son necesarios para que siga estudiando.
