Agradece la oportunidad que recibe ya que le será de gran ayuda para culminar su carrera y cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en: Virginia is from the city of Ybycui, she is 22 years old and is taking the 4th year of the nursing degree. She is the youngest daughter of her family and the only one still living with the mother. She has two sisters and a brother. Her mother is a housewife and her father is a farmer. She is studying thanks to the help of one of her sisters who works at the Ybycui hospital as a nurse. She requests the loan to pay the fee and also to buy books, which she needs in order to be able to continue studying. She is thankful for the opportunity since it will be a huge help to finish her studies and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay the fee and buy school supplies

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en:
Burmaa, 58, is a pensioner and lives with her husband in a common apartment which is in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. All of their children have moved out from their parents' home.  

Burmaa is requesting a loan to change her apartment.  The old Russian heater is broken, bad and dangerous. Sometimes it does not work and usually can’t warm her apartment rooms in winter time. Also it uses a lot of water for warming and this is extravagant. Therefore, Burmaa needs a loan to cover the cost of new and more efficient wall heaters for her apartment. As she mentioned, it will use less water for warming.

loans.use: buy a new heater

loans.name: Fuji

texts.en:
Fuji is a 32-year-old farmer who is married to Elizabeth, a 31-year-old lady. They have two sons, who are 8 and 4 years old. Rudy is studying in the 2nd grade of elementary school and Rifaldo is not at school yet. 

Fuji plants vegetables such as cabbage, onion and cucumber on his own farm. Currently, Fuji is ready to harvest the plants. He usually resells the harvest to the market the next morning. The profit generated from the business enables him to support his family. 

Fuji is thinking of planting more types of vegetables but he realizes that the income limitation is a challenge for him. This situation drove him to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. The loan capital will assist him in providing more seedlings, fertilizer and farming equipment (spade and harrow). Fuji is expecting that the chance to get the loan will become the way to improve the business as well as his family life.

loans.use: buy seedling, fertilizer, and farming equipment

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 40-year-old married woman who is responsible for five school-aged children, residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has operated a farming business to supplement her husband’s income. She cultivates rice and potato crops betweem the two seasons of the year, earning around USD $5.00 per day on average. She is an industrious farmer who always takes care of her crops in the field in order to ensure a high production so that she can send all of her children to school. Her husband shares his responsibilities for the family by trading firewood. 

To improve the business and sustain her family’s needs, Tom would like to request a loan of 500,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) to purchase a trailer for the firewood trading business. This loan will be sufficient capital for Tom to further develop her family-owned business and attain her goal. In the future, she wants to save some of her generated income to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her firewood-trading business.

loans.name: Norng's Group

texts.en:
Norng is aged 47 and married. She lives in the rural village of Thmor Koul with her family and plants maize and cassava as her family's main source of income. She has three children, two of whom are still dependent on her. In her current business, she is able to earn around 20,000 KHR per day to support her family. She has encountered the challenge of a lack of working capital to grow her business. 
Norng has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back her loans with VisionFund. The past two loans have helped her afford to organize her child's wedding. She is leading her group member, who has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy crop seeds for her business and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the land. Norng hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s scrap business.

With the loan investment he will buy scrap in bulk quantity, which will allow him to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits.

Riaz is a housewife, remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very efficient and tries her best to give comfort to her family. She has given birth to five children. She is only able to provide education to two of them while remaining at home.

She is confident about her family’s future and the growth of her husband’s business after investing this loan.

loans.use: to buy scrap for a scrap-selling business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells electronics accessories at Aboadzi near Takoradi, and she has been in this business for a year now. She is married to an electrician and has two children. Patience uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 
Patience will use her loan to purchase electronics accessories. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics accessories.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
A citizen residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sareth is 44 years old and married. She has seven children, only one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been farming one-hectare of farmland for 22 years while her husband is a paid construction worker. 

Sareth’s group consists of two female members and she has been with VisionFund for ten cycles while her group member has been with VisionFund for nine cycles. She successfully used and paid back the loans with VisionFund. Now she is able to earn daily income of up to around 27,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) to support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each, Sareth, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income so as to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 44 years old and is married with four children aged between 12 and 20. She sells chickens and has one year of experience in this work. She currently employs one person to help her. 
Agnes has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more chickens for resale. With any new profits she makes, she will be able to save money for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married to a driver and has one child. They live together at Aboadzi near Takoradi. 
Beatrice sells meat pies and has been in this business for five years now. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their child. Beatrice will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make her meat pies. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make her meat pies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy luchadora, inteligente y muy trabajadora. Se casó hace 11 años y desde entonces vive un feliz matrimonio al lado de Héctor, de 39 años. Tiene tres hijos y junto a ellos vive en la casa que pudo obtener gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo que realiza con su esposo para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste, principalmente, en la venta de artículos, utensilios y accesorios de cocina; vende ollas, filtros de agua, cucharas, platos, extractoras, lavadoras entre otros. Este trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulatoria, ofreciendo sus productos por las calles de la ciudad a sus ocasionales clientes o algunas veces lo hace entre sus conocidos. Todos los productos que vende los compra al por mayor de un centro distribuidor mayorista de la ciudad. Trabaja sola y dice que su mayor inconveniente es que tiene que movilizar toda su mercadería de un lado a otro durante toda la tarde. Lleva en esta actividad 2 años y a pesar de la dificultad que encuentra en el traslado de sus artículos afirma que su esfuerzo lo puede ver recompensando en las ganancias que le quedan. A su vez, por las mañanas es profesora en una escuela ubicada cerca de su casa y se siente tranquila porque los ingresos que obtiene de ambos trabajos le han permitido ir cumpliendo algunas metas que se ha trazado. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede conocer personas, a quienes considera como potenciales clientes, ya que si no le compran en una primera oportunidad brinda sus datos para que más adelante le compren algún artículo. Para el futuro le gustaría establecer su propio local de ventas.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará mayor cantidad de artículos de cocina para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 35, she fights for what she wants, she is a smart, hard-working woman.

She got married 11 years ago and since then she lives in a happy marriage with Héctor who is 39. She has 3 children and with them she lives in the house she was able to get thanks to the work and effort she and her husband have done to improve the quality of their lives. 

Her work chiefly consists of selling kitchen ware, utensils, and kitchen accessories; She sells pots, water filters, spoons, dishes, extractor hoods, washing machines and other items. Her business is a mobile one, she offers her products on the city streets to her occasional customers or at times she sells to people she knows. All the products she sells she buys in bulk at a wholesale distribution centre in her city. She works on her own and says that the worst inconvenience of her job is that she has to move all of her merchandise side to side [of the city] all afternoon. She's been doing this activity for 2 years and despite the difficulties she finds with the moving of her goods she says that she can see her efforts rewarded in the profit she gets.

She is also a teacher in the mornings in a school near her house and that keeps her calm because with the income she gets from both jobs she has carried out some of the goals she has set for herself.       

The thing she likes the most about her job is that she gets to meet people whom she considers potential customers because even if they don't buy from her on their first encounter, she gives them her details so they can buy some of her items later on. 

In the future she would like to have her own store.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and thus she appreciates the opportunity and trust they bestow in her. She commits herself to pay her loan instalments on time. She likes to be part of her communal bank because she sees the other members as responsible and supportive people.

With the money she is requesting (1500 PEN) she will buy a bigger quantity of kitchen ware to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware for selling.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as garden eggs, peppers, tomatoes, and onions along with other food items at Aboadzi, which is near Takoradi.  Faustina has been in this business for some time now, and she wishes to buy other food items that have been requested by her customers. Thus, a loan from Kiva will be used to buy a variety of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 39, Samorn lives in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her and two of whom are still in school. She is a rice farmer with 0.35 hectare of farmland and she supplements her income by planting vegetables. She has been in this business for several years. 
Samorn’s group consists of four members who are all female. Samorn has been with VisionFund for ten loan cycles already. She successfully used the loans to better support her business and family and she paid back her loans with VisionFund. Now she can earn around 26,000 KHR per day. 
Now requesting a loan with her group members, Samorn, who is the group leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her business. She hopes to increase crop yields and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hairdresser and has been in this business for a year now. She owns a beauty salon at Aboadzi near Takoradi. She is married and uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. 
Mary's loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and hair dryers for her beauty salon. She hopes to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and hair dryers.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela sells second-hand dresses, and has been in this business for three years now. She is married and her husband is a driver. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 
Angela is requesting this loan to purchase more second-hand dresses to sell. With her new profits, Angela plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand dresses to sell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 38 years old and is married with three children aged between 7 and 13. She also takes care of seven relatives. She sells clothes for women and some materials for babies etc. Marie Chantal has four years of experience in this work. 
Marie Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes for women and some materials for babies etc. for resale. With any new profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for women and some materials for babies etc. for resale.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina lives together with her husband and child at Aboadzi near Takoradi. Augustina sells footwear, which she has been doing for two years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills.  
Augustina will use her loan to purchase shoes, slippers and sandals for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop from which to sell her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, slippers and sandals for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has been selling slippers, shoes, and sandals at Aboadzi, near Takoradi, for three years now. She is married and has three children. Agnes helps her husband pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase shoes, slippers, and sandals for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, slippers, and sandals for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa propia en el distrito de Túcume, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional sus atractivos turísticos. 

Se dedica a trabajar como vendedora y confeccionista de prendas de vestir desde hace cinco años. Inició trabajando en un pequeño taller de confección instalado en su propio domicilio. Ella ha implementado una pequeña sastrería y allí se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir para ofrecerlas a la venta, por otro lado también encarga ropa al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima para ofrecerla en su puesto de venta.

Rosa trata de sacar adelante a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo, la calidad de las prendas que confecciona han hecho que su trabajo tenga muy buena acogida. Ella desea adquirir ropa y telas para confeccionar y de esta manera complementar su negocio y poco a poco ampliarlo, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograrlo.

Rosa es alegre y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su taller y crear su propia línea de ropa. Ella ya cuenta con experiencia de trabajo en préstamos y ha tenido uno financiado a través de Kiva, con el cual pudo aumentar su negocio, por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad y agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella ahora.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old and single; she lives in her own house in the district of Túcume, which is part of the city of Chiclayo, known nationally for its tourist attractions.

She has worked sewing and selling clothing for five years. She started out working in a small sewing workshop located in her residence. She has set up a small tailor's shop and there she works creating garments to offer for sale. She also orders clothing wholesale in the city of Lima to offer in her shop.

Rosa puts a great deal of effort into building her business; the quality of the garments she creates have helped her business to be very well received. She wants to acquire clothing and fabrics for sewing to supplement and grow her business little by little. As Rosa pursues her objectives, it has become clear that she needs to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

Rosa is cheerful and extremely hardworking. Her greatest desire is to grow her workshop and create her own clothing line. She already has experience working with loans and has had a loan through Kiva with which she was able to grow her business. She feels very grateful to the people who supported her at that time, and she appreciates in advance the people who will help her out now.

loans.use: to acquire clothing and fabrics for sewing to build her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is the woman pounding fufu. She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done so for four years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku, meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She is married and has four children. Comfort uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Comfort plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase maize, cassava, meat, and other ingredients

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 27 years old and is married with four children aged between one and nine. He also takes care of seven relatives. Theogene sells fertilizer. He has two years of experience in this work and currently employs three people to help him. 
Theogene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fertilizer for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for resale.

loans.name: Vanthy's Group

texts.en:
Vanthy, aged 36, lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has three children. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and growing vegetables. Sometimes her husband catches fish for sale to better support their daily needs. Vanthy has been in this business for eight years and earns a daily income of around 14,000 KHR.
Vanthy has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for seven loan cycles while the other group members have been with VisionFund for two to three loan cycles. Vanthy completely paid back her previous loans, and these have enabled her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her business and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the land. With this loan, Vanthy hopes to increase her crop yields and make more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a small-scale trader. She sells meat pies, eggs, groundnuts and bread. She has been in this business for two years now. 
Theresa is a single parent and has three children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Theresa will use her loan to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make her meat pies and bread. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to make her meat pies and bread.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice Amoah sells palm fruit, Gari, beans, eggs, and oil at Aboadzi, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for seven years now. 
Eunice is married with three children. Her husband is an accounts clerk. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Eunice will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to produce her oil for sale. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to be converted into palm oil.

loans.name: Ranulfo

texts.es:
Ranulfo es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, está casado, tiene dos hijas. Es una persona muy activa, responsable y trabajadora con muchas amistades, muy querido en el barrio.
El se dedica a la mecánica, tiene un taller en el cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta entrada la tarde. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y también poder dar trabajo a las demás personas en su taller.
Manifiesta que solicita el crédito por primera vez para la compra de materiales para la terminación de su local propio y de esa forma generar más ingresos en su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ranulfo is from the city of Pilar.  He is a businessman who is married and has two daughters. He is a very active, responsible and hardworking person with many friends and is much loved in his neighborhood.

He dedicates himself to machinery and has a shop where he works every day from very early in the morning until late in the afternoon. His dream is to be able to continue growing and also to employ others in his shop.

He states that he is applying for a loan for the first time to buy material to finish his place and thereby generate more income from his work. He is grateful for the opportunity given him, since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy material to finish his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 25-year-old Roma woman from the Romanis ethnic community. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 3. It is a Roma tradition that people get married at a very young age. Neither one of her school-aged children is attending public schools. Ana is living with her husband, children, and parents-in-law in a village in the southeastern part of Albania. Since the soil in her region is perfect for growing alliums, such as onions, garlic and leeks, residents there have been doing that for a long time. It has proven profitable, despite sometimes the impact of the extreme winter weather conditions.

This is Ana’s second time applying for a loan. She has proven to be a very responsible person, which is why VisionFund Albania considered lending to her again this time. She wants to plant garlic seedlings in the land that she and her in-laws own. The family has been in the agricultural business, planting potatoes, ever since the collapse of the communist era, dating 20 years back. Ana is seeking Kiva lenders’ understanding in this matter.

loans.use: To buy garlic seedlings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells bags of maize and charcoal at Aboadzi, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for five years now.  
Florence is married and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children and pay their school fees.  Florence will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and charcoal for resale. She will use the new profits from her expanded business to produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of charcoal and bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a village in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Pheng is a 46-year-old father of six children, five of whom are still dependent on him and three of whom are still in primary school. Like other villagers in his village, he and his wife farm rice and plant vegetables to make a living. Having been in this business for almost 30 years, Pheng has been able to increase his daily income to up to 25,000 KHR. 
Pheng is on his eleventh loan with Kiva partner VisionFund and he has completely paid back his previous loans. After these loans with VisionFund, he feels happy with his work and confident of being able to make a better living. Now he is leading his group of four to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizes and seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes to increase his family’s income in order to support his children until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizes and seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses and has been doing so for five years now. She is married to a taxi driver. Agnes uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. 
Agnes will use her loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses for resale. With her new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses for resale.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang would like to take a further loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. Hoang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. Hoang also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité  “El Progreso; Actualmente se encuentran  en el cuarto ciclo, y tiene 13 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de ayuda y respeto mutuo.
 Nelly es miembro del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una pequeña despensita bien surtida, donde ofrece los productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que empieza su jornada desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana y termina ya muy noche.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder seguir apoyando a su familia, es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que quiere surtir su negocio con verduras, carnes, bebidas, lácteos  y demás insumos, que son los que mas salida tienen. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The El Progreso communal bank is in its fourth cycle, and it has 13 members.  All of the members work in a helpful atmosphere with mutual respect.

Nelly is a member of the group, and she says that she devotes herself to sales.  She has a small, well-stocked grocery store where she sells basic needs items to her customers.  She is a very hard-working person.  She starts her work day very early in the morning, and she finishes late at night.  

Her goal is to continue working in order to be able to continue supporting her family.  That is why she is requesting the loan.  She wants to stock her business with vegetables, meat, drinks, dairy products, and other supplies, which are the ones that sell the most.

She is grateful for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, dairy products, and other supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá  y está casado con la señora Faustina de 29 años, tienen 1 hija, quien es el motivo de lucha de la pareja.
El Señor Juan es macatero (vendedor ambulante) hace aproximadamente 15 años, tiene clientes formados en la ciudad de Chore, y Gran Asunción. Sus viajes los realiza todos los fines de semana mientras que los otros días se desempeña con mucha dedicación y responsabilidad en su trabajo como playero de un surtidor de combustible. Su esposa es tejedora y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia y también cuenta con una motocicleta que lo transporta a todos los lugares donde necesita ir.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones, prendas, calzados y demás insumos que el vende los fines de semana en forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is from the town of Carapeguá. He is married to 29-year old Sra. Faustina and they have a daughter who is the reason they both work hard.

Juan has been working as a street vendor for approximately fifteen years and has customers in the towns of Chore and Gran Asunción. He travels there every weekend while during the week he works with a great sense of dedication and responsibility as a gas station attendant. His wife is a weaver and helps him with household expenses. Through hard work and effort, Juan has managed to build his own house and also owns a motorcycle which he uses to travel wherever he needs to go.

Juan is seeking a loan to buy sheets, blankets, comforters, clothing, footwear and other items which he will sell in the streets at weekends.

loans.use: buy sheets, blankets, comforters, clothing, footwear and other items

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mariée à un mécanicien, Madame afiwa est âgée de 30ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits génériques, de couches pour enfants  et du jus depuis 2006 dans une boutique louée pour l’exercice de son activité. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en devenant grossiste et assurer l’épanouissement c’est pour cela, elle sollicite De WAGES ce troisième crédit afin d’acheter des marchandises(Produits génériques, couches et autres).
texts.en:
Mrs. Afiwa is 30 years old and married to a car mechanic. She has been a reseller of miscellaneous goods, juice and baby diapers since 2006. She conducts her sales out of a shop leased specifically to that end. 

She is seeking a third loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her activity and become a wholesaler to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous goods and baby diapers for resale.

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.ru:
Николай сельский фермер.  
На своем участке более 15 лет занимается выращиванием винограда и картофеля.
 Ему помогает  38-ми летний сын, который работает водителем.
По наследству  Николаю достался участок земли, на котором растет более 50 сортов винограда.

 Для капельного полива винограда был куплен насос. 

В планах у Николая - заняться селекцией  для выращивания новых сортов винограда.

В личный планах - отремонтировать трактор.
texts.en: Nikolay is a village farmer.  He has been involved in growing grapes and potatoes on his land for over 15 years.  His 38 year-old son, who works as a driver, helps him with the business.  Nikolay inherited a plot of land, which has over 50 varieties of grapes growing on it.  He purchased a pump to provide drip irrigation for the grapes.  Nikolay's plans include getting involved in selecting and growing of new varieties of grapes and to repair his tractor.

loans.use: to grow new varieties of grapes and repair his tractor

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar operates a grocery shop at Aboadzi, near Takoradi. She has done this for some years now. The items she sells in her grocery shop include milk, Milo, sugar, soups, soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees and powdered milk. 
Hagar is married with two children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a wider variety of groceries to sell in her store. With her new profits, Hagar plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a larger selection of grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea is 29 years old and divorced. She lives with her son in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She farms rice to earn her family’s primary income and she supplements her income by selling grocery items. She has been in this business for three years, earning a daily income of around 70,000 KHR, but is able to save less than 10,000 KHR each day. 
Sokea’s group consists of four members and this is Sokea's first loan with VisionFund. She is leading her group members who have been with VisionFund for one to seven loan cycles. As the group leader, she wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the land. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Chicas Creazy Group

texts.es:
Grupo emprendedor mujeres que se hacen llamar Chicas Creazy. Son once integrantes, conocidas y vecinas que pertenecen al municipio de Apodaca.
Entre sus integrantes se encuentra Beatriz, mujer, esposa y madre de dos hijos. Ella inicio un negocio de abarrotes en su domicilio hace más de 10 años y el resultado ha sido muy favorecedor, incluso más de lo imaginaba. Esto la motivo para comprometerse con este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras a adquirir un crédito que le permitiera ampliar la variedad de producto y aumentar la mercancía que hoy tiene a la venta.
Ella confía en que esta inversión seguirá haciendo rendir dividendos y frutos, los cuales le ratificaran con una mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs call themselves “Chicas Creazy.”  They are 11 members who know each other and are neighbors from the town of Apodaca.

Among the members is Beatriz, woman, wife and mother of two children.  She started a grocery store at home more than ten years ago and the result has been very favorable, in fact, more than she’d imagined.  This motivated her to commit to this group of enterprising women to acquire a loan that will allow her to expand the variety of products and increase merchandise she has on sale at present.  She trusts that this investment will continue producing dividends and benefits that will lead to a better quality of life for her.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelida es comerciante hace mas de 15 años tiene una Despensa bien surtida en su casa ubicada en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y dedicada, está casada con el Sr Alberto, con quien tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son profesionales gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que ponen día a día para salir adelante.
Además comenta que comenzó desde muy abajo, tenía un pequeño almacén en la casa de su Madre nada más y ahora gracias a Dios ya tiene su negocio propio. La Sra. agradece a la Fundación paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona y el apoyo que le está brindando.
Solicita el préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con azúcar, yerba, gaseosas, panificados y demás productos, ya que de esa forma tendrá bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelida has been a merchant for more than 15 years.  She has a well-stocked store in her house, located in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Nelida is a very hardworking and dedicated woman.  She is married to Alberto and they have 3 children, two of whom are already professionals thanks to the hard work and effort that they have put in each day to get ahead.

She started out very modestly with a small store that she used to have in her mother's house.  Now, thanks to God, she has her own business.  She thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the trust they have placed in her and the support that they are providing.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products and other items, because in this way she will have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products and other items
